Jennifer vs. The Leprechaun was devised by ROLF! creator L.L. Hundal in observation of the upcoming 20th anniversary of the release of her favorite horror movie, Leprechaun, as well as an opportunity to celebrate her favorite talk show host.

Featuring three pre-generated characters, and a slew of combat maneuvers, this supplement returns ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters to its roots of super-silly, mindlessly violent battle scenarios that are ideal for playing on the side while you wait for your DM to finish with some boring roleplaying thing or another that only involves specific players at the table.

154118.name: Pick Nick
154118.description:
In Pick Nick, each player has two or three insects that they want to move out of the garden to safety. Nick the bird, however, has other plans and will peck at exposed insects to send them scurrying back to the starting line.

To set up, players takes two insects for a short game and three for a longer game; place the leaves into their holders and set them next to the game board so that they cover certain spaces. On a turn, a player rolls the die, then adds one of his insects to the movement track. Once all of a player's insects are on the track, he moves any one of his choice on his turn based on the die roll. If he rolls Nick, he makes the bird pick up one of the insect tokens with his beak, ideally catching one of the opponents! That player must start over with that token. Whoever reaches the end of the track with all of his insects first wins.

154119.name: Old and Angry
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154119.description:
From publisher blurb:

NEVER MIND THE EXPENDABLES--HERE'S THE OLD AND ANGRY!

Once upon a time, they sent bad guys to prison, physical rehab, or the morgue. Harry Callahan. James Braddock, Robert Malone and his wife Barbara Gordon-Malone were forces for good who cut violent and bloody swaths through evil.

But that was a long time ago. For more than 20 years, they have been living quietly in the Shady Acres Retirement Community... but that peace is being disturbed by loud music, obnoxious protesters, and marauding muggers. Hip-Hop Enthusiasts, Occupy Movement Members, and other trouble-makers have invaded their happy home and are threatening the traquility of Bingo Night.

Now these aging champions of justice for the innocent are once again picking up their guns and pulling on their butt-kicking boots to show these punks how it was done in the old days.

ROLF!: Old and Angry features game stats for five classic action characters, and four other characters who are their friends to be protected or foes to be defeated in six Battle Scenarios. Also included are five never-before-presented Traits designed to let you make your own battle axes once you're done playing with the ones we've presented.

HARRY HAS THE MOST POWERFUL HANDGUN IN THE WORLD,
SO YOU KIDS BETTER STAY OFF HIS LAWN!

154120.name: The Mummy's Tune
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154120.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mummy's Tune: It's Sure to Knock Them Dead!

Shock-pop princess Lady GooGoo's latest outrageous stunt will see her performing a 4000-year-old song in the shadows of the Great Pyramids while wearing nothing but a few strips of bacon. The fact the song is reputed to level a deadly curse against anyone who isn't Pricess Ho-Baq, the original pop princess, makes this performance even more exciting for her and her fans. But there are deadly forces arrayed against her--the Muslim Brotherhood, Mummy Cultists, and even Ho-Baq herself.

The Mummy's Tune features four linked Battle Scenarios that combine to trace a bone-chilling storyline fit for a mummy movie from Hammer Films or, perhaps, The Asylum. It includes brand new Traits (Demure and Like An Egyptian), the most complex Spelling that has yet to be fatured in a ROLF! product, and an assortment of Combat Maneuvers not included in the core rulebook. Also included are stats for 13 pre-generated characters, including Mohamed Morsi and his Muslim Brotherhood Thugs, the legendary Prncess Ho-Baq, Egyptologist Lord Charles Wiffleton, and others.

154121.description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Oldenburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Oldenburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
154121.name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Oldenburg

154122.name: The Pimp, the Protester, and the Po-Po
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154122.description:
From publisher blurb:

Witness the Birth of the Occupy Your Gaming Table Movement!

NUELOW Games becomes the first roleplaying game publisher to capture the spirit of the Occupy [Whatever Random Location You Think Of] Movement and deliver it to the gaming table!

Redistribute some of your wealth to NUELOW Games and get your very own copy of L.L. Hundal's ROLF!: The Pimp, The Protester, and The Po-Po. It features three pre-generated characters, new Combat Manuevers and Traits, and the social concience-awakening Combat Scenarios "Pimp vs. Protester," "Your Tax Dollars at Work," and "Help, Help! I'm Being Oppressed!"

Join us today! You won't even have to beat a drum unless you really, really want to!

154123.name: Rise of the Trouser Snakes 2: Whacking Weiner
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154123.description:
From publisher blurb:

To Secure the Future, They Must Fight in the Past!

The Trouser Snakes, rebels from a dark future where only the rich wear pants, thought they had dealt a fatal blow to the plutocratic One World Government... but now they have learned their foes are sending an assassin back to the year 2013 to alter history. Brave rebels plunge through the mists of time to save their group before it was even founded--by saving the life of US politician and renowned sexting expert Anthony Weiner.

Rise of the Trouser Snakes 2: Whacking Weiner is a stand-alone sequel to the ROLF! cyberpunk adventure Rise of the Trouser Snakes. It features statistics for two new Trouser Snakes, the evil Time Killer, NYC Mayoral candidate Anthony Weiner.

154124.name: Climaxxx
154124.description:
Climaxxx is a Roll and move erotic game for two players with similar mechanics to Snakes and Ladders. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the end of the board. However, you lose the game if you have an orgasm before your partner at any time before the end.

The game is played in two separate phases, the first being softer while the second phase is played naked. Throughout the game, players may have to pick a card and do what the image on it explains. Other possible areas are 'Wine/Drinks pauses' and 'Bite the other player'.

The winner gets to dare the other player to do something he or she wants.

From the publisher's website:
The game for lovers that takes you and your partner through a dizzying array of sensuous thrills. Illustrated cards guide you through a series of sexy trials. But be careful! No matter how excited you get, you have to keep your passions in check.

The game includes: - 1 board - 4 decks of cards - 1 die - 1 hourglass - 2 tokens

154125.description:
A war game that fits in the pocket! In Pocket Battles: Confederacy vs Union — the fourth title in the Pocket Battles series — tiles represent troops and troops make up units in your army; just determine the size of the battle, then create your own army from a pool of existing troops. Each tile hits on certain rolls, and some can only melee while others can shoot. Some tiles also have special traits that can affect their whole unit or army.

The basic rules of the game are fairly simple: Two armies face each other in battle. The armies are split into three columns and two rows. Players must decide at the start of the game how many points they will give to their armies, which then determines how many points you must defeat to win.

On your turn, you choose which faction of your army to send off to battle! Attacks are made by using Order Tokens. If no Order Tokens are present on a unit, it costs just one token to issue orders to that unit. Issuing orders to the same unit in the same Battle Round costs you the number of tokens present on the unit, plus one. (If one token is on a unit, it costs two additional tokens to activate it again; with three tokens on the unit, it costs four additional tokens, etc.)

After a round of battle, you may choose to redeploy your units. (Units may move from the back of the row to the front of the same row, from the back of a row to the back of another row, or from the front of a row to the front of another row). Redeployment costs no Order tokens. The battle ends when one army has eliminated at least half of the points in the opposing army.
154125.name: Pocket Battles: Confederacy vs Union

154126.name: I Spy Puppy World
154126.description: Players race against time to find the objects cleverly hidden in colourful illustrations that match the pictures on each card drawn. The player who collects the most cards is the winner. The game includes 6 game boards and 50 different object cards.

154127.name: Revenge of the Nigerian Prince
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154127.description:
From publisher blurb:

BEWARE SPAMMERS--YOUR DOOM IS AT HAND!

When an honorable Nigerian Prince is unable to give away his fortune because his name has been sullied by spammers and scammers, he sets out to put an end to spam emails in a way so final that no software can ever do: With weapons in hand, he seeks out the spam at its source... and puts an end to it, permanently.

ROLF!: Revenge of the Nigerian Prince contains three battle scenarios, five pre-generated characters, and several traits and combat scenarios not included in the core ROLF! rulebook.

154128.name: Amelia vs. the Queen of the 57th Dimension
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154128.description:
From publisher blurb:

On July 2nd, 1937, trailblazing woman pilot Amelia Earhart vanished with her navigator Fred Noonan over the Pacific Ocean while attempting to fly around the world. Her fate has remained a mystery.... Until now.

Amelia vs. the Queen of the 57th Dimension pits Amelia and Fred against the evil sorcererss who rules a distant dimension after she takes them to her world. It features rules for aircraft battles, several new spellings, plenty of combat maneuvers, and ROLF! statistics for Amelia Earhart, Fred Noonan, the alien Nashtar, and the evil queen Malefique.

154129.name: Attack of the Commies from Jupiter
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154129.description:
From publisher blurb:

He searches for peace, but all he ever finds is battle...

John Rambo, trouble magnet and Vietnam veteran, is living peacefully in a New Mexico hippy commune when communists from Jupiter land and declare their intent to conquer Earth. Rambo, ever the reluctant warrior, must once again deal death and destruction in the name of freedom and to save the innocent from oppression.

Attack of the Commies from Jupiter is a ROLF! battle scenario for two gamers (with an option to add a third)that pits Rambo and his hippy friends against the evil alien Chairwoman Yalasha and her Shock Troops. It features five pre-generated characters, two all-new Traits, and one new Combat Maneuver, in addition to several others not featured in the ROLF! basic game.

154130.name: Bathtime on Bear Creek
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154130.description:
From publisher blurb:

Based on the Western Short Stories by the Legendary Robert E. Howard!

In Bear Creek, the menfolk take a bath once a year, whether they need it or not. But this year's bathtime is interrupted by the notorious Black Phantom Gang... and it's up to Breckinridge Elkins to stop them from cleaing up while he and his kinfolk get clean.

Bathtime on Bear Creek is a ROLF! battle scenario for up to five players. It features six pre-generated characters, new combat maneuvers, and new traits. It was inspired by the comedic western stories by Robert E. Howard that feature backwoods trouble-magnet Breckinridge Elkins, and this product also includes the first story Howard penned about the character.

154131.name: Bill Clinton Meets a Girl Scout
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154131.description:
From publisher blurb:

NOTHING CAN PREPARE YOU FOR PRESIDENT BILL CLINTON!

Whether they're from down the block, or from the the planet Jupiter, Girl Scouts are a menace to President Clinton (and visa-versa) in Bill Clinton Meets a Girl Scout. Will his wife Hillary be able to save him from himself before it's too late? Plus, as a special bonus, Julian Assange, WikiLeaker-turned-cowardly crybaby and accused sexual predator, gets to meet some Girl Scouts as well!

Bill Clinton Meets a Girl Scout features a trio of Battle Scenarios for two gamers, ROLF! stats for Bill and Hillary Clinton, Julian Assange, Girl Scout Leader Mel, and the alien Girl Scouts from Jupiter and their leader Chairwoman Yalasha, as well as the expected selection of Combat Maneuvers and Traits not featured in the core ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters but used to design the characters in this set.

154132.name: ROLF! Christmas Chaos
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154132.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Twas the night before Christmas, when all through the house
Not a creature was stirring—except for Bill Clinton who was hoping to get a peek at Santa's daugther while she was in the sauna.

With the Mayan non-apocalypse behind us, NUELOW Games wishes everyone a happy holiday season and present our 2012 Chrstimas Special.

ROLF!: Christmas Chaos features seven different battle scenarios (including the instant Christmas clssics "A Very Clinton Christmas," "Jesus vs. Muhammad," and "When Little Drummer Boys Attack" and a Random Battle Scenario Generator that lets you quickly create additional fights using many of the 18 pre-generated characters included in the product. And then there are some all-new Combat Maneuvers, Traits, and Stuff that you can incorporate into your own characters should you get sick of using or pre-generated ones.

HAPPY CHRISTMAS, ONE AND ALL!

154133.name: Conan vs. Conan
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154133.description:
From publisher blurb:

IT'S A BATTLE THAT'S BEEN THOUSANDS OF YEARS IN THE MAKING!

When Andy buys a weird amulet at a yard sale, he unleashes magical energies that bring Conan, the unacknowledged king of late-night comedy, and Conan, the unappreciated king of Aquilonia, face to face in mortal combat. Who will be left standing? Will the sword prove mightier than the mouth?

Conan vs. Conan is a basic battle scenaro that is compatible with ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters and The Violent Worlds of Robert E. Howard, the RPG included as a bonus in the Fists of Foolishness anthology. Designed for three players, gamers get to assume the roles of Andy Richter, Conan O'Brien, and Conan the Cimmerian... and then beat the heck out of each other. It's fast-playing, mindless fun for when you need a break from Roleplaying.

154134.name: Herbert West vs. the Zombies
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154134.description:
From publisher blurb:

Before there was George Romero, there was H.P. Lovecraft.

Nearly 90 years ago, celebrated writer of the weird and terrifying Lovecraft unleashed his "Herbert West, Re-Animator" series of short stories upon the an unsuspecting world. In those tales, Lovecraft originated the now-standard flesh-rending zombie. This NUELOW Games scenario for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters was inspired by Lovecraft's stories, and is a celebration of his blood-spattered gift to the horror genre.

In Herbert West vs. the Zombies, West is once again restoring life to the dead with his Re-Agent... and once again, things go terribly wrong and he finds himself faced with a hoard of zombies bent on tearing him limb from limb.

Intended for as many as four players, this supplement features statistics for Lovecraft's Herbert West and three different kinds of zombies, as well as new rules material.

WELCOME TO THE BLOODIEST ROLF! SUPPLEMENT YET!

154135.name: Mister Freedom vs. Blowhard
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154135.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ripped from today's headlines! Only Mister Freedom Can Save Florida!

Evil super-genius Blowhard has gained control of the US government's top secret Weather Making Device (WMD) and he plans to destroy the Republican National Convention and all of Floria. Only Mister Freedom (who is secretly mild-mannered Vice President of the United States Joe Biden) can stop him!

Mister Freedom vs. Blowhard features two Battle Senarios. and ROLF! statistics for Mitt Romney, Paul Ryan, the evil Blowhard, and the fabulous Mister Freedom himself! It also includes a number of combat maneuvers and traits not in the core rules for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters.

ROLF!: Like a poilitical convention... only more sensible and more fun!

154136.name: Night of the Easter Bunny
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154136.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hell Hath No Fury Like the Easter Bunny!

When the Easter Bunny decides that Playboy Bunnies are sullying her good name, she goes on a murderous rampage. Can even the Son of God himself stand against her wrath?!

Night of the Easter Bunny is a ROLF! combat scenario for two players. It features new Combat Manuevers, Traits, Spellings, and three pre-generated characters -- the Easter Bunny, June the Playboy Bunny, and Jesus.

154137.description:
Provided free for backers of the Kickstarter campaign for Eminent Domain: Escalation, this Bonus Pack for Eminent Domain: Escalation includes the following:


2 Additional Scenario Cards:
Iconoclast
Double Trouble

Prestige Start Planet: Magrathea
2 Utopian Planets
Hades
Dionysus

Military/Economic Alternate Victory Condition Card
154137.name: Eminent Domain: Escalation Bonus Pack

154138.name: Red Robin vs. The Editor & The Clones of Romney
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154138.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's only natural for politicians to be two-faced...especially when they've been cloned!

When legendary superthief Red Robin was hired to break into U.S. presidential candidate Mitt Romney's home office and abscond with some documents, she thought it would be an easy job. But then she found herself in the middle of vast conspiracy--an effort by The Editor and his evil cohorts to replace important leaders with clones!

Red Robin vs. The Editor & The Clones of Mitt Romney introduces a Clone mechanic useful for those gamers who actually like using ROLF! for more than just one-offs, while giving creative souls raw material to spin ROLF! battle scenarios off from this product. (And if you send them to us, you too can be a published game designer and admired by dozens of people!)

It also features three pre-generated characters, new traits, and the usual assortment of new battle scenarios and combat maneuvers.

The Editor is taking his red pen to the world! Stop him before it's too late!

154140.name: Rise of the Trouser Snakes
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154140.description:
From publisher blurb:

IN THE DARK FUTURE, NO ONE WEARS PANTS.

In the year 2042, only the rich and powerful get to wear pants. However, a brave group of cyberpunky freedom fighters are hoping to change all that--the Trouser Snakes are launching a win-or-die assault on the Wearhouse to liberate a billion or more pairs of long pants and return them to the people!

Many years ago, NUELOW Games lead designer Steve Miller quipped that "no one wears pants in the dark future" while flipping through a copy of the very excellent RPG Cyberpunk 2020. More recently, L.L. Hundal remembered the comment and turned it into a battle scenario for ROLF!

Rise of the Trouser Snakes features three pre-generated rebellious (but pantless) cyberpunky fighters, two villianous agents of the Powers That Be and their evil minions (all of whom are wearing comfortable pants), along with a number of combat maneuvers and traits not round in the core ROLF! rulebook. This expansion also introduces the Jacked Up trait, so you can make you own cyberpunky characters when the mood strikes you..

154142.name: Leben in Dortmund
154142.description:
Game published about the German City of Dortmund.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Dortmund. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

154143.name: Leben in Hannover
boardgamefamily: Cities: Hanover or Hannover (Lower Saxony, Germany)
154143.description:
Published about the German City of Hannover.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Hannover. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

154144.name: Leben in Wuppertal
154144.description:
Published about the German City of Wuppertal.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Wuppertal. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

154145.name: Leben in Würzburg
154145.description:
Published about the German City of Würzburg.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Würzburg. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

154146.name: Leben in Osnabrück
154146.description:
Published about the German City of Osnabrück.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Osnabrück. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

154147.name: Lucca!
154147.description: In the 14th century, the fiercely independent republic of Lucca became the site of bitter rivalries between warring families. But vying for political power wasn't enough. Crammed together inside the city walls, Lucca's noble families built great towers--some spent their entire fortunes--jostling with one another to reach the tallest heights and gain the perfect view of the Tuscan countryside. Build towers to maximize your View of the countryside around Lucca while obstructing the Views of your opponents. The game ends when all of Lucca has been filled, and the player with the most total View wins.

154148.name: Leben in Bielefeld
154148.description:
Published about the German City of Bielefeld.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.

During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Bielefeld. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

154149.description:
Save your life through knowledge of traffic signs! The players have to go from "Start" to the finish space. If the meeples get on a space with a traffic sign, the players have to follow the instructions in the game rules. On a few occations the player may turn the turntable to shorten his way. The first player to reach "Ziel" wins the game.

The game was published in the 1950s.
154149.name: Rette dein Leben durch Verkehrszeichenkenntnis!

154150.name: Super Muslim Bros
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154150.description:
From publisher blurb:

WILL HE SAVE THE DAY?!

You cheered when he defeated international terrorists in ["The Breast Hope for Peace"]! You gasped as he saved Tiger Woods in ["Dragon vs. Tiger"]! Now, get ready for President Barack Obama's most exciting adventure yet -- "Super Muslim Bros"! The future of Egypt hangs in the balance!-

ROLF!: Super Muslim Bros takes on the reborn Egyptian revolution in a fashion so stupid that it could only be a NUELOW Games release. The product includes pre-generated characters, battle maneuvers, and traits not found in the core rulebook, and two all-new battle scenarios featuring President Obama, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, and President Mohamed Morsi in searing battle action!

154151.name: Supermodel Slapfest
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154151.description:
From publisher blurb:

Six supermodels are trapped in a building with a whiny fashion designer and a hunky handyman... and a murderer out to get them all! Sounds like the teaser summary for a slasher film, but it's actually the subject of the latest supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters.

Dangerously close to being a real adventure (as opposed to the usual stuff where characters meet, characters kick each other into oblivion), this 10-page product features new Combat Maneuvers, new Stuff (both Armor and Weapons), eight pre-generated player characters, as well as the maniac who is trying to kill them. Well, who probably will kill them if the egomaniacal supermodels don't kill each other first.

As an added feature, there's a system for secretly making one of the "victims" the killer--just like in the slasher flicks where there has to be a "Big Reveal"--and no one knows who the murderer is until the time is right.

154152.name: The Death of Osama bin Laden
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154152.description:
From publisher blurb:

On May 1, 2011, the reigning Hide-and-Seek World Champion from 2001 to 2011 lost his title and life when United States Special Forces entered his secret hideout and shot him. Now, through the magic of ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters, you can recreate that historic moment, in a scenario constructed with the use of top secret files recovered from the women's restroom in Nordstrom's following a mysterious Tweet.

ROLF!: The Death of Osama bin Laden is the first in a series of historical recreation rollplaying scenarios, because we at NUELOW Games believe in educating while entertaining. It is a two-page supplement that features a three part combat scenario, four pre-generated characters, several new weapons and pieces of armor (including the Princess Leia Slave Bikini Replica and the Beer Hat).

Also included, as a special bonus, is the Official Rolf! Character Sheet for those of you who aren't content with using the pre-generated characters we provide.

154153.name: The Hopping Vampires of Yao Ping
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154153.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The next time you insist we go somewhere classy, I'll remind you about tonight!"

When his girlfriend Joan wanted him to take her to an exhibit of ancient Chinese artifacts, he reluctantly agreed. But the night of cultural education turns into a battle of life and death when it turns out to be a trap set for them by Yao Ping, the Fire Wizard who leads the Cult of Erlik.

The Hopping Vampires of Yao Ping is a spooky ROLF! supplement designed to bring a little mayhem to your gaming table this Halloween season.

Co-designed Steve Miller (one-time designer on the Ravenloft gothic horror roleplaying game setting), it takes its cues from the writings of legendary pulp author Robert E. Howard and Chinese legends as filtered through third-rate horror movies and cheesy Kung-Fu films. It features four pre-generated characters and lots of traits, combat maneuvers, and spellings not featured in the main ROLF! rulebook.

154154.name: The Sheik: A Literary (?) Spoof
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154154.description:
From publisher blurb:

LIKE A STEAMY ROMANCE NOVEL... ONLY EVEN DUMBER!

ROLF! creator L.L. Hundal takes a cue from "The Sheik," a satirical short story written by Robert E. Howard when he ws still in high school, bringing an amorous Desert Sheik and the Swooning Damsel he has swept into his arms to the Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters.

Never have crappy romance novels been laid bare quite this brutally.

In addition to featuring one of the earliest published humor stories by fantasy master Robert E. Howard, this supplement features two pre-generated characters and several Combat Maneuvers and Traits not included in the core game rules.

154155.name: The Year of the Dragon Book Two: "Bond. Jane Bond."
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
rpgseries: The Year of the Dragon Trilogy
154155.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The Name is Bond. Jane Bond."

When Great Britain's greatest secret agent travels to Shanghai to facilitate the defection of Chinese scientist Dr. Hu Yu what should have been a simple mission turns into a fight for her life against a mysterious masked figure and a chinese dragon.

Nothing is ever simple when you're Jane Bond, Agent 002.

ROLF!: "Bond. Jane Bond." is NUELOW Games's kinda-sorta tribute to the greatest series of spy movies of all times. It's also the second entry in the epic Year of the Dragon Trilogy AND the ninth "Final Battle" of a possible twelve, as we help facilitate one last game session in before the prophesized end of the world.

That's a lot to load onto one Fifty Cent game product, and that's even before we talk about the pre-generated characters, traits, combat maneuvers, battle scenarios, and cool drawings within its pages.

Join Jane Bond Of Her Majesty's Secret Service, Because You Only Live Twice and Can Always Die Another Day.

154156.name: Angels, Demons & Death
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154156.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE WORLD IS COMING TO AN END! WHY NOT GO OUT GAMING?!

2012 is the year the world is slated to end, at least that'swhat the Mayans supposedly established with their calander. We at NUELOW Games want to give everyone the chance to play one last RPG session before the end, so each month this year, we've released a Final Battle for ROLF! The Rollplaying Game of Big, Dumb Fighters.

In ROLF! Angels, Demons & Death (AD&D for short--don't tell the lawyers!), the Guardian Angel of Supermodels and the Patron Demon of Excess team up to stop the Grim Reaper from destroying the Universe! If they fail, the Mayans will be proven right.

This epic ROLF! supplement contains five pre-generated characters and lots of new Combat Maneuvers and Traits--including ones to give your made-from-scratch characters wings and the ability to fly, and new Spellings fit for angels and minions of Death.

IT'S THE FINAL BATTLE (#10 of 12)! GET IT BEFORE IT'S TOO LATE!

154157.name: Apocalypse Not
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154157.description:
From publisher blurb:

IT'S THE FINAL FINAL BATTLE!

For all of 2012, the people of the world were quaking in their booties, fearing that the universe would end. (Well, okay... the gullible people of the world were quaking in their booties.)

We here at NUELOW Games hedged our bets by releasing a "final battle" product each month, just in case that month would be the last month ever. But now it's 2013, the world didn't end, so here's the final final battle.

Apocalypse Not features eight pre-generated characters -- including game versions of ROLF! designers Hundal & Miller -- for use in the three included battle scenarios -- "Wild Girls Never Lose It" (in wich an autograph-seeking L.L. Hundal must save Simon Le Bon from doomsday cultists). "The Second Coming of the Millerites" (in which Steve Miller tries to cash in on doomsday fever with disastrous results) and "Apocalypse Not" (which dramatizes a theory about why the world didn't end). Other highlights of this landmark release for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters include new combat maneuvers and traits (such as So Very British).

THE WORLD IS STILL HERE -- SO LET'S GO ON GAMING!

154158.name: Bill Clinton and the Secret City of Women
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154158.description:
From publisher blurb:

"TELL ME MORE ABOUT THESE BINDERS FULL OF WOMEN."

When former President of the United States Bill Clinton heard that SEAL Team Six recovered binders with pictures of six hundred or more sexy women from the lair of Osama bin Laden, along with a map to the secret city where the women lived. Bill, the biggest horndog to inhabit the White House since John F. Kennedy knew that he had found his holy grail. The Binders Full of Women would be his. Unfortunately, Bill isn't the only person hunting for the binders and the path to the secret city.

Bill Clinton and the Secret City of Women is a ROLF! supplement that sends Bill to Aghanistan on a quest to score bigger than any player has ever done in the history of mankind. It contains three battle scenarios, six pregenerated characters, and lots of combat maneuvers and traits not featured in the core rulebook.

154159.name: Crawl! (Issue 9 - Jan 2014)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
154159.description:
From the publisher:

The Curwen Family have lived up among the pine woods on the outskirts of Arwich Village for as long as the oldest village gaffers can remember. The beautiful Bessie Curwen’s bonnet is found in a strange creature’s grasp. The village owes much to her family, so someone must go up into the dark pine-clad hills to make sure that the Curwens are all right. After all, the Curwens saved the village from starvation two winters ago. If you do not go, who will?

The Arwich Grinder is a Lovecraftean 0-level funnel for the DCC RPG written by Daniel J. Bishop.

What in the name of heaven or hell could be happening up there?

Also included, But He Sure Had Guts!, a gruesome short encounter.

154160.name: Dragon vs. Tiger
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154160.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE WORLD IS COMING TO AN END! WHY NOT GO OUT GAMING?

Reportedly, ancient Mayans predicted the world is going to at some point during 2012. Since ancient peoples were never wrong about anything, we here at NUELOW Games are releasing a "Final Battle" every month this year until the end comes. This is The Final Battle #7. So far, so good!

Another thing ancient peoples got right was the fact that dragons hate tigers--a fact we learn from the Chinese Zodiac. Professional golfer Tiger Woods and his friends discover this the hard way when a Chinese dragon attacks with the intent of spilling Tiger Blood on the green and thus ending their ancient rivalry forever!

Dragon vs. Tiger features ROLF! stats for Tiger Woods, Michelle Yeoh, Jackie Chan, and a Chinese Dragon, as well as all the Combat Maneuvers and Traits used that aren't found in the main ROLF! rulebook. Also making a repeat appearance is President Barack Obama, as he and Tiger join forces to battle terrorists. (Obama is making his second ROLF! appearance, the first being in The Breast Hope for Peace.)

DRAGON vs. TIGER... ONLY ONE WILL WALK AWAY FROM THE FINAL BATTLE!

154161.name: Escape From Eden
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154161.description:
From publisher blurb:

Objective: Save Humankind From Destruction Before Humankind Exists

It's the Final Battle for ROLF! (#3)

When time-traveling Eco-Terrorists go to the Garden of Eden with the intent of killing Eve, only one man can stop them and save us all: Snake Plisskin.

Escape From Eden is a supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big, Dumb Fighters. Intended for two players, it features new Traits, new Combat Maneuvers, seven pre-generated characters (including Snake Plisskin, Adam & Eve, Lilith the first Ex-Girlfriend, and the Serpent), and five linked Battle Scenarios.

Return to where it all began in the most epic of epic ROLF! products!

Escape From the Garden of Eden is the third Final Battle for NUELOW Games' ROLF! game line. We're doing one every month of 2012, until the world comes to the end that was predicted by the all-knowing ancient Mayans.

The World is Coming to an End! Go Out Gaming!

154163.name: Fallout 3: Game of the Year Edition
videogamefranchise: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)
videogamecompilation: Fallout 3 – Broken Steel and Point Lookout
154163.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Fallout 3 and its 3 Game Add-On Packs.

154173.description:
7 Ronin is an asymmetric two-player game in which one player controls a group of ninja attacking a village that's defended by seven ronin (masterless samurai), which are controlled by the other player. The ninja player wins by occupying five of the village's ten areas, while the ronin player wins by surviving eight rounds.

Each turn starts with the players distributing their forces over the village areas simultaneously and separately. Their choices are then revealed, and combat resolved. Each of the ronin have a different special ability to aid the defender, while each of the village areas have a special ability usable by the attacker once it has been occupied.
154173.name: 7 Ronin
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 012 – Essen 2015 Highlights Show
Ep 47 Grey Fox Games with Josh Lebkowicz
Episode 25 - GenCon Recap!!
Podcast #29: Nightmares at the Hilton
Strange Assembly 190 - GenCon 2016 Preview
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 61 - 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 1

154174.description:
The Rock! Paper! Scissors! Lizard! Spock! Dice Game contains 3 red dice, 1 black die, and 24 small chips. The object is to be the last player in the game who owns a chip or chips.

Each player starts with 3 chips. A player rolls the black die and places it in the center of the table. This is the die that all players will be competing against.

The first player rolls all three red dice. The player compares their dice to the black die, and loses chips for each die that is defeated by the center black die. They also pass a chip to the player on their left for every die that instructs them to do so. For every die that matches the black die in the center, the player passes a chip to the player on their right.

When all players have had a turn, the black die is rolled again, and a new round is begun. Play continues until only one player has chips remaining.
154174.name: The Big Bang Theory: Rock! Paper! Scissors! Lizard! Spock! Dice Game
boardgamefamily: TV Series: The Big Bang Theory
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Five Point Five: Someone Has Gas
The Big Bang Theory Rock! Paper! Scissors! Lizard! Spock! Dice Game

154175.name: Crash
154175.description:
Set Up:
Place the a ring on a flat surface and put a column in each of the recesses. When each recess is occupied place another ring on top and fill in the same way. Alternate the column colours as you complete each ring. Repeat this process until all the columns have been used, you will be left with 4 spare rings.

Game Play:
- The youngest player starts the game, play then continues in a clockwise direction.
- On each go, players throw the coloured die. They then have to remove a column with the same colour as the die, from any ring except the top.
- All removed columns are replaced on the top ring of the tower, when all the recesses to the top ring are full a new ring is added.
- If the topples during a player's turn they are eliminated from the game, the tower is rebuilt and play continues with the remaining players.
- The winner of the game is the last player in play!

Objective:
The object of the game is to be the last player to skilfully remove the columns from the lower levels of the tower to the top, without making the tower topple.

Contents:
11 rings, 60 columns, game die.

154176.name: The Game of Courage
154176.description:
Courage is a squad based wartime strategy game where players vie for control of the battlefield using custom troops, secret orders, and subterfuge. Acting simultaneously, 2-8 players take on the role of Axis or Allied forces and engage in anything from small skirmishes to epic team battles. Courage emphasizes the use of tactics and troop management over luck to win the battlefield.

The game of Courage is an accessible yet deep and intuitive strategy game designed for fast paced simultaneous play that keeps all players in the action, every turn.

154177.description:
Zeppeldrome: Faceoff is set in the same steam punk world as its multi-player namesake, Zeppeldrome. It is a serious race through silly obstacles for two-players, with a hazardous board and cards that are used to help you or mess with your opponent as you both race to be the first to travel the length of the airship raceway.

The first player over the finish line is the winner!

The boards one center piece contains a mixture of hazards. Additionally, 2/3 of the deck are variants of Zeppeldrome's cards, but the remaining 1/3 are all new.
154177.name: Zeppeldrome: Faceoff

154178.name: Underworld Lore (Issue 1 - Fall 2013)
154178.description:
from the website:

UNDERWORLD LORE is a new zine chock full of OSR community-generated content for your fantasy campaign! For the premiere issue we've got a bangin' table of magical gems found in the eye-sockets of select animated skeletons, a whole mess of crazy mushrooms ripe for foraging in the deep dark below, a never-before-seen PETTY GOD & more besides. I expressly designed this thing with printing in mind, but it looks rather swank on the screen too.

154179.name: Erntedankfest
154179.description:
Goal: Be the first to reaching position '50' (Thanksgiving)

Game Play:
Typical 'roll & move' game - Roll the die by turns and step forward - ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

Notes:
Contains pewter pawns

154180.description:
In a formidable Indian landscape, a burgeoning marketplace is forming. Opportunities are ripe in this community of traders, bankers, moneylenders, and dealers of grains and spices. Fortune awaits the one who plans well and uses his resources wisely. Oil, silk, incense and spices are the currency used to build tents, establish settlements, and amass riches — but commerce brings competition, and the space to build is limited. When there is no more room, the player who has maximized his resources to become the most successful merchant is the victor!

In Bania, players use resource cards to buy and build tents, then strategically place these tents on the board to earn points. When no legal moves remain on the board, the game ends and the player with the most points wins. On a turn, a player performs these actions in order, if possible:


Collect your bonus: If your elephant marker sits on a tent tile on the board, collect one resource card of each type in the settlement where the marker is located.
Buy and place tent tiles OR roll for resources: As explained below.
Place your elephant marker: If your elephant marker isn't on the board and you placed tent tiles that turn, place the marker on one tile you placed this turn.


Each player starts the game with four tent tiles and eight resource cards: two of each type (oil, spice, silk and incense); one side of the tent tiles shows one of these four resources, while the other side shows three resource symbols (e.g., two spice and one silk). If you want more resources, you can roll the four dice up to three times, locking any dice that you wish while doing so. When you stop rolling, you receive one resource card for each resource symbol showing; in addition, if you have both a front and back half of an elephant showing on the dice, then you receive an elephant marker bonus as at the start of your turn.

If you have the right cards in hand, you might instead choose to buy and place tents; if you have twelve or more cards, then you must do so. A tent costs three resource cards matching the three resource symbols on the back and you pay this cost after placing a tent on the game board, but if you place a tent adjacent to other tents, then the cost is discounted based on the colors of adjacent tents, possibly allowing you to place a tent for no cost at all! When you place a tent on its own to start a settlement, you receive 3 points; for all other tents placed, you receive 1 point each. You refill your hand to four tent tiles at the end of your turn — but if you've placed all four, you can immediately draw four new tiles and keep building!

A settlement can have at most seven tents in it; when someone places the seventh tent, any elephant markers in the settlement are removed and returned to their owners. The game ends when no more tents can be placed. Whoever placed the final tile scores 3 points, and whoever has the most of each type of resource card scores 2 points. The player with the most points wins.
154180.name: Bania

154182.description:
In Helios, players are high priests in a distant world of the sun god AHAU, and the power of the sun drives everything in the game as players try to build temples, expand cities, and make their civilization flourish.

Development can succeed, though, only if you've secured a supply of the limited raw materials available, and the more that you've built of your temple, the more expensive the remaining parts will be. Glass manastones are the game's currency, and with them you can acquire people, increase the number of points you'll score, and more.
154182.name: Helios
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 30 -- Long-eared, Humanoid, Dwarf People Praying to the Sun
Episode 81-- Gen Con 2014 Top 11 to Try and Top 11 to Buy with special gues W. Eric Martin from BGG News
The Game Pit: Episode 26 - Picking Over the Bones

154183.name: The Grim Reaper vs. the Fertility Goddess
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154183.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's the End of the World, so Here's the Final Battle (#1 of 12)!

At least it will be, at some point during 2012 if the Mayans are to be believed. But they kinda forgot to give us the exact date, so we here at NUELOW Games will be offering 12 different Final Battles for the ROLF! Rollplaying Game. (Well... we hope it will be a maximum of 12. Who knows how far we'll get before we all die/transcend/become Republicans?)

And what better way to start a series of products marking the Mayan-predicted End of the World than with one featuring a Mayan Goddess? If there is one, we can't think of it.

The Grim Reaper vs. the Fertility Goddess: The Final Battle #1 contains three pre-generated characters (Ix-Chel the Mayan Moon Goddess, the Grim Reaper, and, making his second ROLF! appearance, Chuck Norris. It also features Traits, Combat Maneuvers, and a deadly new Spelling. And. last but not least, there are three exciting Battle Scenarios that see Ix-Chel and Chuck Norris battling Death, and Ix-Chel having to fend off an amourous Chuck Norris.

The Mayans Predicted It! NUELOW Games Wants to Exploit It!

154184.name: Reborn From Flame
154184.description:
You are a citizen of the town of Bastion. Your town guard have been slain by barbarians. And now they are coming for you. Your job is to defend your town. You are no great warrior. You are no mighty soldier. You are just a normal citizen. But you are also Bastion's only hope.

The Last Bastion is a competitive game for 1-4 players. You goal is to train enough with the village elders to be able to save your town, then go out and defeat the barbarian horde. Train too much and the horde will overrun the town. Train too little and you will be trampled. Will you be the hero of Bastion, or it's martyr.

154185.name: EpicTable Virtual Tabletop
154185.description:
Easy to Use
Standard Windows interface
No-hassle networking
Share files easily — even drag from your browser onto the tabletop!
"Kitchen table" licensing

System Embracing
Any game you can play on your physical tabletop
Easy-to-use, yet robust and powerful dice roller
Play the latest indie game, your favorite OSR clone, or your own homebrew system

Like a Real Table!
Move and sort virtual dice on the tabletop - play Dogs in the Vineyard online
Index cards, tokens, virtual miniatures, and text objects
Draw on a virtual wet-erase battlemap or import your favorite map images

Philosophy
EpicTable is about keeping groups together and building new ones.

To achieve that, we believe that it's important to get out of the way—to make the virtual tabletop as fast and easy to use as your physical tabletop.

That's why we use a centralized messaging system to avoid networking configuration issues, why we handle all the transfer of images and other data for you transparently, and why we don't try to do a lot of rules automation that forces you to do a lot of prep for the sake of the tool instead of for your players and your game.

154186.name: The Date of Doom
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154186.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is coming to an end... and if Dr. Demon has his way, it'll end today!

Angry at a world who doesn't respect him and is full of excessive ATM fees, a villianous mystic decides to unleash the Demonlord of Destruction upon North America. Can the pure-hearted Dr. Incorruptus save us?!

Well, probably not. But, unfortunately for Dr. Demon, he picked 12/12/12 and Mount Blackheart to perform his ritual, the time and place where a young angel and young demon had picked for their first date. And they did not appreciate having their time together interrupted....

ROLF!: The Date of Doom continues NUELOW Games's countdown to the prophesized end of the world. This release is a sequel to Angels, Demons & Death. It features the return of Millie the Angel and Myron the Demon, as well as four new pre-generated characters. Also featured are four new Spellings to bring demons and other supernatural chaos to your ROLF! battles, and a number of other Combat Maneuvers and Traits not featured in the core rulebook.

Whether you like superheroes or the supernatural, this is the ROLF! supplement for you! (And it's a better love story than Twilight.)

154187.name: The Death of Adolf Hitler
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154187.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's the Final Battle Before the End of the World (#4)!

History records that one of the most evil men to ever walk planet Earth, Adolf Hitler, took his own life on April 30, 1945. But the facts surrounding his death have long been questioned.

In the grand tradition of The Death of Osama bin Laden and Icing Oetzi, NUELOW Games proudly presents another Historical Recreation that educates while entertaining by shedding light on a pivotal historical event with facts as they were found in top-secret government files and the personal diary of Chuck Norris.

This supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters features several Combat Maneuvers and Traits not found in the core rulebook, as well as full game statistics for Adolf Hitler and the four people who sealed his fate: Baroness Blood, Captain Nazi, Chuck Norris, and Jon, the Most Interesting Man in the World.

ROLF!: The Death of Adolf Hitler is another Final Battle from NUELOW Games, as we count down to the End of the World that was predicted by ancient Mayans for 2012. This may be the last game scenario you ever play, so get don't wait until tomorrow to buy it!

154188.name: George Washington Carver and the Nuts of Doom
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154188.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World is slated to end, so we bring you the Final Battle (#2)!

Some believe the ancient Mayans predicted the end of the world at some point during 2012, but there's uncertainty about when during 2012 the world is going to end. Just in case, we all die early, NUELOW Games is releasing a final ROLF! product every month this year, each with its own theory as to how the end might come. Real Gamers will go out rollplaying!

And while the Mayans may have predicted the End of the World, they did not envision the nightmare that Dr. Ghoul will visit upon the Earth if he succeeds in turning the world's women into men! They could not have imagined the horror and devastation that the Power of Peanuts will create when it is used for Evil instead of Good.

But there is still hope! George Washington Carver, undisputed Master of Peanut Power, has traveled through time to 2012 to save us all!

George Washington Carver and the Nuts of Doom presents four linked Battle Scenarios tracing the development of Dr. Ghoul's evil master plan from 1922 through 1942 and to the final year of 2012. It also contains seven pre-generated characters (George Washington Carver, Jimmy Carter, Dr. Ghoul, Black Cat, Black Kitten, Peanut Brutes, and Swedish Bikini Team Members) and several Combat Manuevers and Traits for use in creating your own ROLF! characters.

Final Battles: The Mayans Predicted the End. NUELOW Games Exploits It!

154189.name: Mad Scientists Gone Wild
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154189.description:
From publisher blurb:

The usually sedate gathering of mad scientists for the annual EVIL awards erupts in chaos and death-ray fire when several attendees set their romantic sights on Dr. Candi Floss after she has a falling out with her husband and partner in scientific crime, Dr. Tooth. It’s hard for the brainiacs of crime to make love connections, so they're going to eliminate anyone standing in their way... even if that someone is Dr. Floss.

Mad Scientists Gone Wild features six pre-generated mad sciensts, the zombots, and six linked battle scenarios with which to pit them against each other. The supplement is compatible with alll version of ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters, including The Violent Worlds of Robert E. Howard, and presents a new Trait and rules for outfitting characters with Death Ray Guns.

154190.name: POTS vs. PANS
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154190.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World is Coming to An End, So Why Not Go Out Gaming?!

There are those who say that the Ancient Mayans predicted the world is going to end in 2012! We here at NUELOW Games are accepting of all beliefs--even the stupid ones--so we're producing a Final Battle product each montyh this year until the world ends, or 2013 arrives.

We hereby proudly present POTS vs. PANS: The Final Battle (#6), a full-color superhero extravaganza! (Will there be 12 Final Battles? Only the Mayans knew for sure!)

In POTS vs. PANS, the decades-long, cross-generational feude between the pure-hearted American superheroes who make up the roster of PANS (Patriotic American Native-born Superheroes) and the dastardly international league of supervillians POTS (People's Organization for Terrorism and Socialism) comes to a head. When this battle is over, one side or the other will be wiped from the face of the planet... and if PANS loses, hundreds of innocents will die in a nuclear blast.

As many as eight gamers cam play this battle scenario for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters. It features new traits, new combat maneuvers, stats and character portraits for nine pre-generated costumed heroes and villians. such as Butts Pirate & Butts Boy, tireless anti-smoking crusaders; Captain Freedom, the Gay Patriot; Texas Hellion, a feminist crusader for the Right to Bear Arms; Red Raider, dedicated foe of anti-Communist forces the world over; Spirit of the People, North Korea's Own Superhero; and Mother Eve, a mysterious mystic whose powers seem to derive from the serpent wrapped around her body.

154191.name: R. L. McSterlingthong and Nikola Tesla vs. the Daughter of Skull-Face
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154191.description:
From publisher blurb:

IT'S THE FINAL BATTLE (#8)

The Mayans predicted the world would end some time in 2012, and NUELOW Games is giving everyone a chance to go out gaming by offering a Final Battle for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters each month until the End comes. Will we make it to 12?

We might, but only because the legendary author R.L. McSterlingthong and mad scientist Nikola Tesla recently joined forces to stop the Daughter of Skull-Face and her Kathulos Cult from committing who-knows-what vile acts.

In the tradition of previous Historical Recreations, like ROLF!: Icing Oetzi and ROLF!: The Death of Hitler, you can relive these momentous events using the material in this supplemnt--the ROLF! stats for McSterlingthong, Tesla, and the Daughter of Skull-Face, as well as Spellings, Combat Maneuvers, and Traits not featured in the basic rulebook.

ALMOST AS EPIC AS AN R.L. McSTERLINGTHONG NOVEL, THIS IS ONE ROLF! SUPPLEMENT YOU DON'T WANT TO MISS!
(Because the world may end tomorrow...)

154192.name: Hammerin' Tongs: A Tribute to Robert E. Howard
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154192.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Ain't no galoot gonna knock out Steve Costigan without a rematch!"

Celebrated pulp-fiction writer Robert E. Howard wrote over 300 short stories in his too-short life. The character he wrote the most about was Steve Costigan, a sea-faring prizefighter with a habit of getting into trouble. It's a character who seems tailor-made for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters!

In Hammerin' Tongs: A ROLF! Tribute to Robert E. Howard, Steve Costigan crosses paths with another Howard creation--hard-bitten police detective Steve Harrison--and they join forces to beat the heck out of the Son or Erlik Kahn and his Tong Hatchet Men.

This supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters contains four pre-generated characters, three Combat Maneuvers designed to bring the feel of a Howard-written boxing tale to ROLF!, and three linked combat scenarios.

154193.name: Cap'n Jack on the Isle of Pirate's Doom
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154193.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Avast, shipmate! There be ninjas chasin' yer booty!"

When a mysterious Ninja Master captures and transports a hoard of pirates, along with Captain Jack, Captain Jack, and Captain Jack, to an uncharted Caribbean island, it's kill or be killed in search of an answer to the eternal question: Who rules--pirates or ninjas?

Cap'n Jack on the Isle of Pirate's Doom presents more rollplaying mayhem for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters. This offering features five pre-generated player characters (including Cabribbean Pirate Queen Helen Tavrel, three different Captain Jacks, and the sinister, villain known only as The Mustache) and four different kinds of generic goons to be turned to hash (Ninjas, Somali Pirates, Copyright Pirates, and Pirates of the Caribbean), in addition to new Combat Maneuvers and Spellings.

154194.name: Chinese Take Out
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
rpgseries: The Year of the Dragon Trilogy
154194.description:
From publisher blurb:

MURDER AND MAYHEM! WITHOUT MSG!

When two assassins with past history come face-to-face in Seattle's Chinatown, it's a foregone conclusion that one of them will be taken out. But if the mysterious figure who brought them together, they will both be as cold as an uneaten eggroll by day's end.

Chinese Take Out is a fast-playing battle scenario for ROLF: The Rollplaying of Big Dumb Fighters inspired by Hong Kong action flicks like Angel of Vengeance... and the half-eaten lunch on L.L. Hundal's desk. It features a two-stage battle scenario and four pre-generated characters to use with it. Also included is an assortment of combat maneuvers and traits not found in the core ROLF! rulebook.

Oh... and it's the first in The Year of the Dragon Trilogy. So, please tell us about the GREAT QUESTION by emailing us or leaving us a message at the NUELOW Games blo; you might have an impact on Books Two and Three. (Because we probably don't have any answers...)

154195.name: Exit the Dragon
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
rpgseries: The Year of the Dragon Trilogy
154195.description:
From publisher blurb:

EXIT THE DRAGON...

When martial arts instructor and daycare provider Leigh Bruce is mistaken for a reborn Bruce Lee by wiitless minions of the mysterious mastermind known only as the Great Question, she finds herself fighting for her life as the Year of the Dragon gives way to the Year of the Snake.

ROLF!: Exit the Dragon is the third and final entry in the Year of the Dragon trilogy. It provides none of the promised asnwers about the Great Question... but we may get around to giving some answers in the Year of the Snake Trilogy. Instead, we offer two all-new pre-generated characters, an all-new trait, and an all-new Spelling--along with a bunch of Combat Maneuvers and Traits not found in the ROLF! core rules. This send-off to the Year of the Dragon also contains a collection of previously presented pre-generated characters to make creating your own battle scenarios a breeze.

154196.name: Gaddafi's Angels
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154196.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hello Angels!

Although their leader is dead, the all-female fighting force known as Gaddafi's Angels carries on the fight against the sinister Agents of HUMMUS, with a new voice giving them direction over the red phone that was their one-time connection to Colonel Muammar.

ROLF!: Gaddafi's Angels is another fact-based supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters (well... fact-based in the sense that the recently overthrown and murdered Libyian dictator did comport himself like a real-world Blofeld or Dr. Doom and did surround himself with armed hotties as bodyguards; and that Sarah Palin is a woman of mystery). It features three combat scenarios and five pre-generated characters, including game stats for Gaddafi's Angels, the Agents of HUMMUS, Colonel Muammar Gaddafi, and Sarah Palin. Also included are a selection of Combat Maneuvers featured in previous ROLF! supplements, but repeated here for ease of reference.

154197.name: Pirates vs. Fairies
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154197.description:
From publisher blurb:

When legendary pirate Black Vulmea joined the crew of Captain Bell on a voyage to loot rainbow gems on the mysterious Isle of Fairies, they come face-to-face with the magical beings themselves!

ROLF!: Pirates vs. Fairies returns the Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters to its fantasy roots with four unusual battle scenarios, five pregenerated characters, and brand-new traits that will let you make your own fairy characters.

154198.name: St. Patty vs. The Snake
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154198.description:
From publisher blurb:

Superhero Action To Make Every Day Into St. Patrick's Day!

Ireland's own superhoerine St. Patty squares off against her two greatest foes--the Snake and Tee-Totaler--in a final battle to save the world's beer, whiskey, and redheads.

ROLF!: St. Patty vs. The Snake features four pregenerated characters, two all-new Spellings (Luck o' the Irish and Venomous Touch), three linked Batttle Scenarios, and numerous Battle Maneuvers and Traits not included in the ROLF! core game.

154199.name: The Breast Hope for Peace
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154199.description:
From publisher blurb:

Huda thought it was possible!

A bikini model ushers in hope, change, and the possibility of world-wide peace! Her simple act of posing on the cover of a magazine brings world leaders together as never before, and a Golden Age is about to dawn on Planet Earth. Well, unless terrorist suicide bombers and Martian Special Forces don't put a stop to this digusting outbreak of peace and harmony.

ROLF!: The Breast Hope for Peace was inspired by the real-world controversy surrounding model Huda Naccache's appearance on the cover of Lilac Magazine. Written with all the insight and sensitivity displayed in The Death of Osama bin Laden and The Pimp, the Protester, and the Po-Po, Steve Miller and L.L. Hundal proudly present yet another work that informs while it entertains. (And they reveal the top secret true origins of Kim Jong Il while they're at it. Learn what the CIA and the Red Chinese don't want you to know!)

Featuring new combat maneuvers, traits, and five battle scenarios, this expansion also includes game stats for Huda the Bikini-clad Wonder herself, Barack Obama, Pope Benedict, Ayman al-Zawahiri, Chuck Norris, and five other major international figures. (And then there's the stats for Suicide Bombers and the Martian Special Forces....)

154200.name: The Temp of Frankenstein
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154200.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wanted: Experienced Nurse for Quiet Job at Frankenstein Manor.

The request was for a nurse to assist with the care of a homebound patient for one night only, and Nurse June was more than happy to take the job. Too bad she didn't know that nothing is ever easy--or safe--when Dr. Frankenstein and one of his Monsters is involved.

The Temp of Frankenstein is a ROLF! combat scenario inspired by Z-grade horror movies. It features four pre-generated characters fighting it out in a plot that might well have come from the mind of Jess Franco, or Charles Band. (But since we couldn't afford to hire even one of those guys, we had to settle for ROLF! co-creator Steve Miller.)

154201.name: Bat Meets Cat
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154201.description:
From publisher blurb:

It May Be the End of Chicken Sandwiches as We Know Them!

When the public gets stirred up over statements made by the general manager of Baba Yaga's Chicken Hut, militant chicken rights crusaders seize the opportunity to turn the citizens of Guardian City away from tasty chicken sandwiches forever.

When the villainous Chickenhawk sets into motion the final stage of his nefarious plan, only the mysterious Caped Crusader known as Black Bat and Guardian City's latest superhero Black Cat can stop him. If the fail, thousands of children will be killed by their free school lunches!

ROLF!: When Bat Meets Cat brings you the latest superhero-oriented battle scenarios for L.L. Hundal's fast-playing ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters. It presents five pregenerated characters and several new Combat Maneuvers, Traits, and a new Spelling.

154202.description:
Roller Derby is a contact sport where 2 groups of 5 skaters from rival teams compete on an oval track to score the most points.
Your duty as the coach of one of these teams is to lead them to victory.

JAM is a card game for two coaches, or teams, based around the Movement Programming mechanic.
154202.name: Jam: The Roller Derby Card Game

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork & Presentation Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Winner
2014 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee
154203.description:
Settlers from four major powers of the world have discovered new lands, with new resources and opportunities. Romans, Barbarians, Egyptians and Japanese all at once move there to expand the boundaries of their empires. They build new buildings to strengthen their economy, they found mines and fields to gather resources, and they build barracks and training grounds to train soldiers. Soon after they discover that this land is far too small for everybody, then the war begins...

Imperial Settlers is a card game that lets players lead one of the four factions and build empires by placing buildings, then sending workers to those buildings to acquire new resources and abilities. The game is played over five rounds during which players take various actions in order to explore new lands, build buildings, trade resources, conquer enemies, and thus score victory points.

The core mechanism of Imperial Settlers is based on concepts from the author's card game 51st State.
154203.name: Imperial Settlers
boardgameaccessory: Imperial Settlers: Character Meeples Scoring Markers

What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 77!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 93!!

154204.description: Caverna: Christmas Chamber is a postcard expansion for the Caverna board game that consists of a single tile in both English and German. With the tile, for 1 wood you can furnish a cavern for Christmas and earn 4 points at the end of the game.
154204.name: Caverna: Christmas Chamber

154205.name: The Shivil War
154205.description:
Free P&P game! Requirements - at least 3 A4 pieces of paper, 6 D6 and 1 D10.

The Shivilnecks have had it with being the Husk's breakfast, lunch and dinner, but they're just too tasty for the Husks to give up! So, from thereforth the Shivil War began.

Each player will need to deploy each of their 6 units one at a time, each with a custom made weapon or spell unique to that unit. It's up to the player to make the most out of their unique abilities and slay the opposition; gaining the means to secure your home territories and win the game.

- A typically round consists of 3 phases, namely:

The Recruitment Phase, in which both players choose a unit to recruit and forge them the kind of weapon or spell the player thinks will be the most useful, given the success of their Recruitment Roll. Choose wisely - you can never recruit two rounds in a row.

The Activation Phase is where most of a action takes place. Move and attack with any units you can with the hopes of slaying an enemy unit and receive it's bounty of 1 coin. Or, if the unit is already carrying a coin it's a race straight back to it's home square, where it can lock it down and finalise their role in the game.

The Purchase Phase simply lays down the opportunity to gain the upper hand via the purchase of an upgrade. Although these may seem like a novelty, some of the more useful features of the game such as the top tear weapons and routine healing. Choose wisely!

154206.name: ROLF! Christmas Special II
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154206.description:
From publisher blurb:

MERRY CHRISTMAS IN JULY FROM NUELOW GAMES!

For the second year in a row, Steve Miller and L.L. Hundal have baked Christmas pudding, guzzled lots of rum-spiked hot apple cider, and gamed and typed to the wee hours to come up with a ROLF! Special that will awaken the Christmas Spirit in even the Grinch. Play these combat scenarios, and you'll be wanting to rush out for Black Friday and do battles at the mall for special deals!

The ROLF! Christmas Special II features the return of beloved ROLF! Christmas in July icons Sugar Plum and Jesus Christ, in addition to game stats for Lady Gaga and Zombie Michael Jackson. Also included are lots of Combat Maneuvers and Traits as well as three Battle Scenarios full of Holiday Cheer: "When Drunken Santas Attack," "Jesus vs. the Zombies," and "Return of the King."

154207.name: Revenge of the Martians
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154207.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Twas the Night Before Christmas... and Martians were storming the North Pole!

Once upon a time, Santa Claus, Billy, and Betty were kidnapped by aliens and brought to Mars. The Christmas Spirit prevailed and Santa won the day. Now, five decades later, the Martians have returned, and Billy, Betty, Santa's daughter Sugar Plum, and Santa's loyal Elf Commados must battle the Martians again--and Santa's life hangs in the balance!

ROLF!: Revenge of the Martians is a sequel to the classic Christmas movie (Christmas turkey some might say) Santa Claus Conquers the Martians. Authorized by Saint Nick himself, this supplement features half a dozen pre-generated characters together with the combat maneuvers and traits needed to fill your ROLF! game with cheerful Christmas chaos, and six linked battle scenarios that tell the epic tale of the night the Martians struck back.

Also introduced in this set are some simple vehicle design and combat rules that can add a new level of play (and mindless mayhem) to your ROLF! games.

A Merry Christmas to All, and to All a Good Fight!

154208.name: Santa vs. Santos vs. Jesus: The Battle for Christmas!
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154208.description:
From publisher blurb:

All is not well at the North Pole! The most evil Luchador to ever be booed in the squared circle has taken the elves hostage and is threatening to BBQ Donner if Santa doesn't face him in battle. Is this end of Christmas?!

"Santa vs. Santos vs. Jesus" is a ROLF! battle scenario for as many as four players, possibly even five if a group is particuarly large and inventive. It includes five pre-generated characters--the Jolly Old Elf himself, Santa's youngest daughter Sugar Plum, luchador Santos Malvado, Jesus, and. of course, Jesus... because you can't spell Christmas without Christ. Also featured are new Combat Maneuvers, Traits, Spellings, and optional rules for hats. (That last bit is a personal favorite of NUELOW editor and ROLF! co-creator L.L. Hundal.)

THE FATE OF CHRISTMAS IS IN YOUR HANDS! SAVE IT! FOR THE CHILDREN!

154209.name: Superhero Bakery
154209.description:
Publisher's Blurb: No Action, No Adventure, Just Baking

You were given two choices: Spend all eternity in the Ice Prison of the All-Seeing GodStar, or agree to a work-release program.
You chose the work-release program.

Now you and a few of your old enemies are stuck in a kitchen - not even a super-kitchen, just an ordinary kitchen—baking bread, pastries, pies and cookies. Sanitizing sinks. Scrubbing out grease traps. Not spending all eternity in the Ice Prison of the All-Seeing GodStar.

Nice work if you can get it, right?

154210.name: The Fireman vs. The Firewitch
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154210.description:
From publisher blurb:

Burning Down the House!

A brave firefighter plunges into a raging inferno to save innocents from certain deathm only to find himself face-to-face with the denizens of the World of Rolf--Firewitches and their Living Flame servants!

The Fireman vs. The Firewitch is the latest supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters, and it's exactly what the title implies. It contains three pre-generated characters--a fireman, a firewitch, and a firewitch's apprentice--as well as statistics for Living Flames and new Spellings.

154211.name: Warrior-Poet
154211.description: Publisher's Blurb: WARRIOR-POET is a four-player game of player conflict and outlandish duels to the backdrop of battle-haiku – great spell-poems that weave and shape the world around them in service of the desires of the Immortal Ghost Emperor.

154212.name: Revenant
154212.description:
Publisher's Blurb: Revenant is a game designed for one Player and one Narrator to tell a story about passion beyond death. Inspired heavily by films such as Ghost and The Crow, Revenant is about wanting something so bad that you will defy the laws of mortality to see it done.

Using playsets called Mementos, the Player can create her character with Passion enough to crawl out of the grave and accomplish an all-encompassing Drive. The Narrator is responsible for creating the obstacles that will stand in the Player's way.

Revenant is released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike license. This PDF is available for free and may be freely distributed under the terms of its license. You are encouraged to come up with Mementos of your own to share with other Narrators.

154214.name: Pirateas
154214.description:
User Summary:' Pirateas is a freeform tea party game. Each player is a Pirate returning home with a mysterious barrel of tea, and will tell the story of their tea while the other Pirates attempt to sort out lies from truth and get to the bottom of the story.

This is the English Translation created for the Epimas Bundle, 2013.

154215.name: Creature Feature: The ROLF! Halloween Horror Show
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154215.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mummies and Zombies and Vampires, Oh My!

It's All-Hallows Eve and intrepid monster-hunters Lady Emma and Professor Tarkington have vowed to put an end to the reign of terror that Baron Nemutor and his undead minions have visited upon the peasants of Transylvania. But who will be victorious when the sun comes up... the monsters or the monster-hunters?

Creature Feature!: The ROLF! Horror Show is a celebration of the spooky stuff that makes Halloween fun, not to mention another excuse to have characters bash the heck out of each without any motivation deeper than they happen to be in the same room with one another.
