Designed by Steve Miller, co-creator of ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters, and contributor to numerous products for Ravenloft, the venerable gothic horror game setting from TSR and Arthaus, this supplement includes six pregenerated characters (two heroes and four monsters), new combat maneuvers and traits, and a three-part combat scenario that puts the best of Hammer Films to shame! (Okay, so that last bit might be hyperbole... but this is an attempt to get you to spend your money after all!)

154216.name: Black Kitten vs. June Collyer: A ROLF! Valentine's Day Special
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154216.description:
From publisher blurb:

Valentine's Day Mayhem!

When superhero Black Cobra rescued acress June Collyer from a pack of zombies roaming the streets of Burbank his troubles were only starting. This just-another-occurance in the life of a superhero filled superheroine Black Kitten with a jealous rage--she wasn't going to let some two-bit B-movie hussy steal her man!

Black Kitten vs. June Collyer pits two obscure superheroes against each other and a nearly forgotten actress from the early days of Talkies. It's three romantic battle scenarios as only NUELOW Games could (or would, because no one else in their right might would headline Black Kitten and June Collyer on aything thses days) bring you.

154217.name: Nine Days of the Ninja
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154217.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Go Ninja! Go Ninja"

When legendary martial artists come under surprise attack from marauding Ninjas, it is a prelude to an adventure unlike any other!

Nine Days of the Ninja is a supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters that features nine battle scenarios that form an epic tale that captures all the excitement and coherence of a Joseph Lai/Godfrey Ho movie! With legendary martial artists and Evil Ninja Master Maurice translated into the ROLF! system, along with a slew of Combat Maneuvers and new Traits, this release is sure to fill your craving for Ninja Action!

154218.name: Dead Presidents
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154218.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abraham Lincoln & John F. Kennedy in a Battle to Save America!

When Adolf Hitler and Kim Jong-Il decide to destroy the United States of America from the Afterlife, only Abraham Lincoln and John F. Kennedy can stop them!

"Dead Presidents" is a ROLF! battle scenario for 4 players set in the misty confines of John Kendrick Bangs' Hades (as described in Houseboat on the River Styx). It features statistics for Abraham Lincoln, John F. Kennedy, Kim Jong-Il, and Adolf Hilter.

It's a Presidential Battle Royale!

154219.name: Day of the Turkey
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154219.description:
From publisher blurb:

HAPPY THANKSGIVING!

In the Year of Our Lord 1666, a family of pilgrims was saved by a mysterious, mustachioed man when they found themselves in a life and death struggle against a demonic turkey. Their savior? A time-traveling Edward D. Wood, Jr.!

Day of the Turkey allows four gamers to relive the historic battle when the legendary maker of turkeys turned turkey killer! This combat scenario for ROLF!: The Roleplaying Game for Big Dumb Fighters, or The Violent Worlds of Robert E. Howard, is designed for 2-4 players and features four pre-generated characters, including two pilgrims, Edward D. Wood Jr., and the dreaded Demon Turkey!

"This is your silliest idea yet."
(Editor L.L. Hundal to designer Steve Miller)

154220.name: Serenade for Sirens in G Major
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154220.description:
From publisher blurb:

Happy death-day (and birthday) Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart!
(January 27, 1756 - December 5, 1791)

It was a nice day when Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart joined Jimi Hendrix, Michael Jackson, and Ophelia on the bank of the River Styx practice Mozart's latest composition. But things turned sour when Tiny Tim and the Three Sirens picked that moment to take revenge for Mozart not inviting them to work with him.

Serenade for Sirens in G Major is a ROLF! combat scenario set in John Kendrick Bangs' world of Houseboat on the River Styx that sees Jimi Hendrix and Michael Jackson square off in musical combat against Tiny Tim and the Three Sirens... with a special appearance by Ophelia on the vocals and the cowbell! It features new Combat Manuevers and ore-generated characters.

But it might need more cowbell.

154221.name: Playwrights and Piledrivers
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154221.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Is it nobler to be beat senseless by Shakespeare or the Macho Man? That is the question. Oh YEAH!"

We return to the hazy riverbanks in Hades just in time for the ultimate tag-team battle for who gets to claim authorship of the Complete Works of William Shakespeare! In this corner—The Earl of Oxford and Sir Francis Bacon... and in this corner, William Shakespeare and Macho Man Randy Savage!

Playwrights and Piledrivers is a supplemet for 'ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters inspired by John Kendrick Bangs's Houseboat on the River Styx, Roland Emmerich's Anonymous, and a couple centuries of cricical silliness and conspiracy theories. It features six pre-generated characters--including Edward de Vere and Macho Man Randy Savage--new Combat Manuevers, and fiction written by Steve Miller (or maybe Sir Francis Bacon... we'll never know for sure. But it's an undeniable fact that everything is better with Bacon!)

154222.name: The Tornado vs. Steve Costigan
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154222.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Unmovalbe Object Meets An Unstoppable Force!

When sea-faring boxing champ Steve Costigan travels to Oklahoma to help an old flame save her farm, he finds himself facing not only the fearsome Tornado Thommerson in the ring, but also the even more fearsome tornadoes of Mother Nature herself.

ROLF!: The Tornado vs. Steve Costigan contains pre-generated characters, snippets of fiction and battle scenarioes for two players featuring the character created by Robert E. Howard. It is being offered by NUELOW Games in an effort to raise funds for disaster relief in the way of the tornadoes that struck Oklahoma in May of 2013.

154223.name: Kinofune
154223.description:
Kinofune is a tabletop ship combat game that pits players against each to blow each other up to tiny bits and pieces. It utilizes an in-teresting ship build mechanic where players pick their components from a shared resource pool of dice rolled at the start of the game. This means games will always be different since the strengths and weaknesses are randomized at the start of every game.

A winner is declared when all of the opponent's ships are destroyed. Different scenarios offer different win conditions, such as whoever earns the most victory points after 5 rounds or who can capture the mine first.

The game is also unique because of the pieces. The ships are hand-made out of wood in a tiny workshop in the USA., assembled by the one-man-team known as Alexander Shen. Because they’re made of wood, they are also completely open to endless customization op-tions.

154224.name: A Recipe for Evil
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154224.description:
From publisher blurb:

SOMETHING STINKS IN THE KITCHEN

When students from the famous Chef Gordon Blue's cooking school go on killing sprees at mall food courts, Sally the Sleuth is send in undercover to find the cause. The question isn't whether she'll crack the case, but if she'll avoid getting tied up by the bad guys while doing so.

The first woman detective in comics, and possibly even the format's first Good Girl, returns for another knock-down, drag-out fight against 6 oddball crooks in her second set of ROLF! battle scenarios. This supplement includes six pre-generated characters, five battle scenarios, a new Spelling, and several Combat Maneuvers and Traits not found in the core rules.

As a special bonus, ROLF!: A Recipe for Evil also contains a seven page comics story from Slly the Sleuth's creator, Adolphe Barreaux.

154225.name: Hawaiian Manhunt
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154225.description:
From publisher blurb:

WILL SALLY GET HER MAN?

Sally's Hawaiian trip started as a spy-hunt, and she hopes it will end with a wedding. But her happy day will be a long time coming if the Gay Deserado has anything to say about it!

ROLF!: Hawaiian Manhunt features a classic Sally the Sleuth episode by Adolphe Barreuax, a trio of outrageous battle scenarios that form a sort-of sequel by ROLF! co-creator L.L. Hundal, and pre-generated characters and two all-new Spellings ("Change Trait" and "Oh, No You Didn't!"

154226.name: Turkey Shoot
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
154226.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE TURKEYS COME HOME TO ROOST!

When a maniacal film fan threatens the life of a director notorious for making bad movies, it's up to the brave agents of the Central Legal Investigative Taskforce to stop an atrocity of a non-cinematic kind. But can even Sally the Sleuth survive the wrath of the Turkey Avenger?!

Turkey Shoot is a ROLF! battle scenario inspired partly by the adventures of Sally the Sleuth as they appeared in the pulp magazine Spicy Detective Stories. It includes ROLF! stats for Sally, her sidekick Peanuts, and the boss Chief Brady... as well as stats for filmmaker Dr. Uwe Boll and the fearsome Turkey Avenger.

Also featured are a selection of Combat Maneuvers, Traits, and an esay-to-play Battle Scenario. As an additional treat, we've also included are some old time comics by Sally's creeator Adolphe Barreaux. We're sure you'll find them a perfect compliment to the level of quality that ROLF! is famous for! (Dr. Boll is nothing compared to us at NUELOW Games when it comes to making turkeys!)

Turkey Shoot is compatible with all versions of ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game, including the free ROLF!: Old Skool. If you haven't tried rollplaying before, this is a great opportunity to do so.

154227.description: クイーンズブレイド (Queen's Blade) - THE LIVE is a series of gamebooks, licensed from and fully compatible with Lost Worlds, set in the Queen's Blade Universe. A distinctive feature of this series is their use of live models to portray the characters in the various battle situations. Furthermore, LIVE characters may differ from their original counterparts (e.g. THE LIVE Airi is no longer undead).
154227.name: Queen's Blade: The Live

boardgamecompilation: Neuroshima Hex! Żetony promocyjne – zestaw I
154228.description:
He does not obey any rules. Does not ally with anyone. Walks his own paths. Pray not to meet him.

Assassin token belongs to no faction. Any player can play it on the board instead of one of his own tokens. When placed on the board any player can play the Battle tile to activate him - instead of triggering the Battle the Assassin attacks. During a Battle he attacks no one. When killed he can be played on the board once again the same way.

Tile is available as a reward in Dice Tower Season 10, 2014 Kickstarter campaign.
154228.name: Neuroshima Hex! Assassin
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

154230.name: Cast of Thousands
154230.description:
Abridged excerpt from the 2008 PDF, What is Cast of Thousands?
Cast of Thousands is a dice mechanic and set of rules that players can use for "cinematic wargaming". The entire system is summed up in four points:

Roll as many six-sided dice as you wish! You must roll at least two.
A 4-6 on a dice is a success. Each extra success raises the Success Level.
Double '1's are a Mishap.
Three or more '1's are a Calamity.

154232.name: Cast of Toys
154232.description: Cast of Toys a one-page set of rules for battles between armies of toy miniatures, like those from Eureka Miniatures's Toytown range. It's based on Cast of Thousands by the same author. Most actions are resolved by rolling a bunch of six-sided dice and consulting a table.

154233.name: A Cast of Thousands
154233.description:
From the publisher's website:
At long last a game that enables you to use all the figures in your collection at once. From Cavemen to the Far Flung Future, Hollywood encompasses it all.

Promote your stars, hire your extras, shoot your films and try to make it the movie business.

User summary:
A Cast of Thousands is an unusual miniatures game in that its "combat" represents psychological confrontations, like "shouting matches". Losses cause cast members to quit and leave the movie set.

Players maneuver their director and whatever cast they can to film on a chosen set, possibly chasing off rival crews. Each successful film improves the director's and the star actor's rating (i.e., power). A player wins by getting their director to a five-star rating.

The authors' similarly named 2008 title, Cast of Thousands, is explicitly credited on the publisher's website as inspiration, but the games are substantially different from each other.

154234.name: Jungle Temple
154234.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, full color floorplan of a Jungle Temple.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps.

“To not offer a sacrifice to the sun god will ruin our crops. Even if she is your daughter Inul.”

The Jungle Temple is a single external view map of a jungle surrounding a small open top temple that appears to be ruined by overgrowth.

The Jungle Temple is intended for use in fantasy or modern games. Some of the stranger looking trees could also make it appropriate for an alien world in a sci-fi game.

Adventure hook for use with this product.

Summer Solstice: The jungle temple appears abandoned and overrun by plants and trees. However, one day a year the followers of the temple gather for the summer solstice to perform a sacrificial ritual at noon. A girl is sacrificed to the sun god and her blood offered to the jungle plants. This blood magic ritual imbues the local jungle trees with the power to animate and protect the temple for one year. The jungle itself will attack anyone who does not follow the sun god and approaches the temple. This act however kills the tree, which explains the odd number of dead trees in the otherwise fertile area.

The player characters can get involved by being attacked by the jungle trees and having a chance to save the person to be sacrificed and disrupt the ritual. If they attempt to save his daughter, Inul, the father, helps the player characters to save his daughter from the sacrificial knife. Or the player characters have a chance to explore the jungle temple for treasure and secrets when the sun cultists are not present after the jungle tree ambush.

boardgameimplementation: Railway Rivals Map SWE: Southern Sweden
154235.description: This is an expansion map of Southern Sweden for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. The base game involves route building and the second part of the games involves racing along player routes between cities to win prize money. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.
154235.name: Railway Rivals Map SV: South Sweden

154236.description: This is an expansion map of France for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. The base game involves route building and the second part of the games involves racing along player routes between cities to win prize money. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.
154236.name: Railway Rivals Map FR: France

154237.name: Dark Ages: Darkening Sky
154237.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oath-Truce fell with the darkening sky

In May, 1230, an eclipse overwhelmed the sky, blurring the lines between day and night. What does this mean in the Dark Medieval World? Ask five people, expect ten answers.

Darkening Sky is a series of five stories for the Dark Ages game lines. You’ll find a story for Fae©, Inquisitor©, Mage©, Vampire©, and Werewolf© inside, each with a unique twist on the 1230 eclipse.

Dark Ages: Darkening Sky includes:

Each story is a fleshed out toolkit for exposing players to the horrific events surrounding the eclipse.
Play these stories as part of existing chronicles, or use them to launch dark new epics.
Each of these stories offers tools for running the game in the other four game lines.

154238.name: Alloy
154238.description:
From publisher blurb:

ALLOY!

Ready to pummel anyone that stands in her way, Alloy is a steel-clad criminal that's ready to take on your campaign's heroes! Strong, durable and ready for action, she's a metallic mercenary and takes on whatever job that can pay her.

154240.name: Underworld Lore (Issue 2 - Nov 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Latrine Lore of the Slatternly Mermaid
The Crypt Cockerel: Chicken of Choice
154240.description:
from the website:

Underworld Lore #2 doubles down on the page-count from the previous issue with oodles of weird and useful junk for fantasy campaigns.

154241.name: Rollenspiel, was ist das? – Einsame-Insel-Edition
154241.description:
designer summary in English

A business card-sized rolepalying game that aims at also being an explanation of what a roleplaying game is. The players take the role of castaways on a lone island. Character creation is based on questions. Risky endeavours are resolved by the player choosing between consequences supplied by the other players. The mechanics are designed to be simple and encourage a short, single-session game.

Publisher blurb (German):

"Rollenspiel, was ist das? – Einsame-Insel-Edition" ist ein minimalistisches Rollenspiel für Neulinge und Erfahrene gleichermaßen. Auf einer einzigen Klappvisitenkarte werden die Charaktererschaffung, das Setting, die Erzählstruktur und eine Konfliktmechanik präsentiert. Es geht – Überraschung! – um Schiffbrüchige, die auf einer einsamen (oder eben nicht!) Insel stranden und diese so bald wie möglich verlassen müssen. Dabei entdecken sie die Insel und werden kaum umhin kommen, gewagte Unterfangen einzugehen.

Im Fall einer gewagten Handlung müssen die Charaktere zwischen den Konsequenzen ihrer Handlungen abwägen. Hier werden gewichtige Entscheidungen der Charaktere gefordert – für mich eine der Grundessenzen des Rollenspiels.

Das Setting und die Mechanik sind bewusst so gehalten, dass sensible Themen nicht explizit thematisiert werden. Gewalt etwa ist zwar möglich, aber nicht das Fundament des Spiels.

154243.description:
Play a round of Menu Mash-Up and get ready for a hilarious game night everyone will remember. Cooks use Ingredient and Prep cards to create a menu that fills the Diner's order (whether it's delicious or downright off-the-wall). The Diner chooses the menu that best fulfills the order—awarding the Dish card to the Cook who prepared it. Whoever earns the most Dish cards wins the game. Menu Mash-Up is the ultimate game for the food obsessed.

This game plays like Apples to Apples, but instead of a one to one card match, you match a number of cards that add to a meal to match the dish card drawn.
154243.name: Menu Mash-Up

154244.name: The South Shall Rise Again
154244.description:
The South shall rise, and the North will follow fast upon its heels. Two titans will battle for this Nation, and they will not be, as the President had hoped, the “better angels of our nature.” Death will walk the land and not one of us will know peace, not even in the grave. - Private John Picket, in a letter home, Taunton, MA, June, 1861.

From designer John Welch comes your chance - with up to three additional friends to alter the course of a fractured United States, increasingly menaced by Confederate zombie soldiers (“Zebs”), and the dangerous Revenants and Glorious Dead that await you.

Based on the alternate history of author S.M. Cross’ The South Shall Rise (pending publication), this is a game of tactical combat set during the American Civil War, where those within the Confederacy take a terrible risk to use the dead as reanimated soldiers. With four unique and challenging scenarios to choose from, crawl out of the trenches and rise to glory… or die (again) trying.

Good luck... you’re going to need it!

What's in the box:

• One 36-page full-color Rules booklet
• One 11” x 17” map
• 20 standees
• 45 counters
• 25 cards
• Five scenario cards
• One player aid
• Two six-sided dice
• One 11” x 17” mounted, jigsaw-cut game map
• One bright red, 9 1/4" x 5 7/8" Standard cardboard VPG game box
• One beautiful box cover sleeve
• One "Wipes-A-Lot" napkin
• One charcoal desiccant packet

http://victorypointgames.com/details.php?prodId=254

154245.name: Underworld Lore (Issue 3 - Feb 2014)
154245.description:
from the website:

Underworld Lore #3 is the means to craft one serious Cimmerian campaign setting with added bits of unseriousness thrown in for good measure. James Mishler is largely to thank for the former aspect of this issue -- with both his detailed hex map of the country of Cimmeria (and surroundings) & his practical gazetteer that describes this landscape. Combine this with copious facts, myths and dark lore about the Hyborian Age and its peoples, creatures and gods and you have practically everything you need to explore the wilds of Conan's homeland in your next campaign. Well, minus the ruleset. That's up to you.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
154246.description:
Ready to start exploring a previously uncharted island? Good! You and the other players each have a team of five scientists, and you want to capture animal species so that you can study them — and, of course, score points.

The game board in La Isla consists of a set of oddly-shaped tiles that are placed in a circular arrangement around a central polygonal tile. Thirty-five animal tokens (seven each of five types) are placed at random on spaces numbered 2, 3 and 4 on the game board; these numbers equal the number of camps that surround these spaces.

On a turn, a player has three cards that he places face-down in the A, B and D spaces on his card display. All players reveal their A cards at the same time, then place them in one of the three slots at the top of their display; the image depicted on the top of this card shows the special power that the owner of this card has available. Once a player has filled all three slots on her display, future cards placed with the A action cover an existing card.

After revealing the cards in their B slots simultaneously, the players collect the goods depicted in the lower-left corner of their individual card.

Each player in turn then places one of his scientists on a camp, first paying two resources of the type matching that camp. (If all of a player's scientists are on the board, she moves one of these scientists.) If the player now has a scientist on each camp surrounding an animal space, she takes that animal tile, scoring points for it as noted on the board (4, 3 or 2 points).

Finally, the card in the D slot increases the value of one animal. You (and only you!) immediately score one point per animal of the type you moved up on the scale. If you don't have an animal of that tpe you don't get any points. Each animal has a points threshold so that if you move an animal up, say, four times, each animal of this type is worth an extra point at the end of the game. The scale goes up to five so that every animal can be worth up five points at the end of the game. When the sum of these values for all five animals equals seven, nine or eleven (based on the number of players), the game ends at the conclusion of the round. Players then tally their final scores to see who wins.
154246.name: La Isla
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 48 - La Isla
Boards Alive Monster Mash-up - Episode 5
Dukes of Dice Podcast - Ep. 09 - Tribal Spiel
Ep 010 – Games we always have with us
Ep. 21 – Spiel des Jahres Trivia & Predictions | Podcast of Nonsensical Gamers
Episode 33: Zombie 15 and Gaming Groups
Episode 41: Scoville and Party Games
Episode 46 - Arcadia Quest
Episode 50 -- Just Doing Our Jobs
La Isla (aleas / Ravensburger): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 222
Planeta de Juegos 29 - Lo que nos espera en Essen 2014
Podcast #086 - ¿80 eurazos?
Strange Assembly 183 - Orléans and Friends
The Game Pit: Episode 31 - Essen 2014 Treasure Hunt Special (part 1)
The Spiel #209 - Point Salad
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80

154247.name: WWII: The Struggle for Europe
boardgameimplementation: WWII: The Struggle for Europe and Asia
154247.description:
WWII: The Struggle for Europe simulates the Second World War at a strategic level. It features seasonal turns and a unique combat featuring historical leaders, initiative, the movement of reserves, and alternating movement rather than more the predictable "you move / I move" system. Geographic influences on play includes mountainous, forested, wooded, rough and arid terrain, major rivers; amphibious assaults, air transport, supply, rail movement and more. This game is designed for players who would like to buy their own miniatures, paint and mount them.

The game consists of a beautiful 4’x6’ rolled-up map board of the European Theatre – from the Urals to the Atlantic and from Murmansk to the sands of the Middle-East; as well as files for all of the necessary charts, unit counters and rulebook on a disk. Players will need to print and mount the counters which have all been sized to accommodate miniatures which players can purchase and paint to their taste.

WWII: The Struggle for Europe can be played by 2-7 players, but is ideal as a 4-5 player game (1-2 Western Allies; 2 Axis and a Soviet player). Tabletop space is recommended to be at least 4’x8’ to accommodate the map as well as the battleboards and country charts needed to play the game.

154248.name: Back to the Dungeon (Vol 1, Issue 4 - Nov 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Combat and Tactics (Because Most of You Will Die Without Them)
A List of (Some of) the Religions of Raven's Keep
On the Map from Issue I
The Natural 20 and 1 and the Consequences of Luck
The Raven's Keep University: A Closeup
154248.description:
from the introduction:

Greeting mortals! This is the fourth issue of the Back to the Dungeon Zine for LL/AEC! Much has happened as your fair narrator and writer has finished a long excursion into a 99 nights of work give or take bad weather and fatigue days. He is tired and grouchy and is in need of bourbon of high quality!

154249.name: WWII: The Struggle for Asia
boardgameimplementation: WWII: The Struggle for Europe and Asia
154249.description:
WWII: The Struggle for Asia simulates the Second World War at a strategic level. It features seasonal turns and a unique combat featuring historical leaders, initiative, the movement of reserves, and alternating movement rather than more the predictable "you move / I move" system. Geographic influences on play includes mountainous, forested, wooded, rough and arid terrain, major rivers; amphibious assaults, air transport, supply, rail movement and more. This game is designed for players who would like to buy their own miniatures, paint and mount them.

The game consists of a beautiful 4’x6’ rolled-up map board of the Asia & Pacific Theatre – from Aleutians to Ceylon and from Novosibirsk to Fiji; as well as files for all of the necessary charts, unit counters and rulebook on a disk. Players will need to print and mount the counters which have all been sized to accommodate miniatures which players can purchase and paint to their taste.

WWII: The Struggle for Asia can be played by 2-5 players, but is ideal as a 4 player game (2 Allied and 2 Japanese players). Tabletop space is recommended to be at least 4’x8’ to accommodate the map as well as the battleboards and country charts needed to play the game.

154250.description:
From the publisher's website:
Muckers who continually survive combat grow in size and strength until they become a warchief. Orcneas, called “Master of Masters” by the Grubbers and Muckers who follow him, is one such leader. Riddled with scars and wielding two axes the size of men, Orcneas charges into combat felling any who stand against him. His roars of rage and command affect heroes and minions alike. Those who dare to harm Orcneas find he has many surprises in store for them.
154250.name: Myth: Orcneas, Master of Masters Expansion Boss

154251.description:
Prepare to get schooled. The Iron Zombies of Professor Albus Von Schtook have graduated and are ready to enter the world...for a price.

Iron Zombies may be used as as Ressurectionist Horrors, as a scenario complication between two crews, or in the included solo play scenario.

"The supplement itself contains rules for the Iron Zombies when they activate, two new Scenarios ('School of Hard Knocks' and 'Recruitment Drive' and a solitaire scenario for a single player called 'Matriculation'."

High quality plastic models and M2 stat cards:

The Valedictorian (50mm base)
Student of Sinew (40mm base)
Student of Steel (30mm base)
Student of Viscera (50mm base)

Assembly instructions

Story Encounter Booklet/rules for using the Iron Zombies as part of a crew, as antagonists to harry fighting crews, or as opponents to test your own crew in a solo scenario
154251.name: Malifaux: The University of Transmortis Story Encounter

154252.name: Sergeant Major
154252.description:
Sergeant Major is a trick-taking traditional card game for 3 players using a standard 52 card deck. It takes its name from its popularity among members of Britain's Royal Air Force.

Multiple variations of the game exist. The two most common are the 9-5-2 (also known as the Canadian version) and the 8-5-3 (the British, Indian and Near-East Version).

8-5-3 version:
As per http://www.pagat.com/whist/sergeant.html

Object of the Game
The aim is to win as many tricks as possible. If a player succeeds in winning 12 or more tricks in one hand, the game ends and that player wins.

Deal and Card Exchange (first hand)
The first dealer is chosen at random. The cards are shuffled, cut and then dealt singly, 16 to each player. The last four undealt cards are placed face down on the table to form a kitty. The dealer names a suit as trumps (clubs, spades, hearts or diamonds - "no trump" is not allowed), discards any four cards face down, and takes the four undealt cards from the kitty in their place.

The Play
The player to dealer's left leads any card to the first trick. It is compulsory to follow suit if able to; a player holding no card of the suit led may play any card. Each trick is won by the highest trump it contains, or if there are no trumps in it, by the highest card of the suit led. The winner of each trick leads to the next.

Targets and Scoring
Each player has a target. The dealer's target is 8 tricks; the player to dealer's left has a target of 5 tricks; and the player to dealer's right needs 3 tricks. A player who won more tricks than the target is said to be up by the number of tricks won in excess of target. A player who failed to reach the target is down by the number of tricks short. The player(s) who are down pay one stake per trick short of target, and the player(s) who are up receive one stake per overtrick.

Deal and Exchange (second and subsequent hands)
The turn to deal rotates clockwise, so the new dealer is the player who led to the first trick previous hand. The pack is shuffled and cut and 16 cards each are dealt singly as before.

Now each player who was up on the previous hand gives away one unwanted card per overtrick to a player who was down, and that player must return the highest card(s) held of the same suit(s). The exact procedure is as follows:

If just one player was up, that player gives each of the other players as many unwanted cards face down as they had undertricks. These cards are all given simultaneously. The other players add these cards to their hands, and for each card received, they give back face down their highest card of that suit. A player who has no other cards of the suit received will of course have to give back the same card.
If two players were up, the player with the higher target for the hand about to be played trades first. This player gives (face down) as many cards as he or she had overtricks to the player who was down, and that player gives back face down the highest card(s) held in the same suit(s). After that, the other player who was up gives a card per overtrick to the player who was down, and receives in exchange that player's highest card(s) in the same suit(s).

After this exchange of cards is complete, the dealer names trumps, discards four cards and takes the four undealt cards. If the dealer was down and had to give away the highest card of a suit, but then picks up one or more higher cards of that same suit from the undealt cards, any such high cards must be shown privately to the player(s) who traded cards in that suit.

The play and scoring then proceeds as described above. The targets are always 8 tricks for the current dealer, 5 for the player who leads to the first trick, and 3 for the other player.

End of the Game
The game ends when any player succeeds in winning 12 or more tricks in one hand, thereby winning the game.

9-5-2 version:
The game is identical to 8-5-3 apart from the following:

The targets for the three players are:
Dealer - 9 tricks
Player to dealer's left - 5 tricks
Player to dealer's right - 2 tricks.
After trading cards and choosing trump, the dealer picks up the four kitty cards before discarding four.

If the the actual dealer was down by 3 tricks or more in the previous turn and gives 3 of his highest cards accordingly, he may look at the kitty before choosing trump.

A cumulative score for each player is kept on paper. The score for each hand is assessed based on whether the required number of tricks were taken (zero score), more tricks were taken (plus score of number of tricks over required tricks) or fewer tricks (minus score of number of tricks under required tricks). Scores are totalled with the score from previous hands, and the total score of all three players should always be zero.

9-5-2 is played to a target score agreed in advance, usually 10, 15, or 20 points. The game ends when someone's score reaches or exceeds the target (with that person winning) or when someone's reaches or exceeds the negative value of the target (with that person losing and ending the game).

Other versions exist such as the 9-5-3 variation with no kitty (played in the Royal Navy), 6-3-8 played with 51 cards and no kitty,and the 7-4-1, a 4 players variant with its own entry in the database.

154253.description:
The King has called on the Adventurers of the realm to rid the land of evil. Defeat a great Dungeon Guardian and you could gain riches beyond imagination. Will you answer the call?

Adventure IN! invites you and up to 4 more Adventurers to explore dungeons in the quest to find treasures and brag about your exploits!

As you journey you will stumble upon Encounters, cards featuring some sort of creature or hazard. You typically must defeat at least two in order to face the Guardian of the Treasure Horde, the ultimate Encounter! Each time an Encounter is defeated* you level up, gaining the ability to use more powerful Treasures, such as items which heal and grant special abilities, and equipment and weapons that boost your abilities.

Adventure IN is two games in one! The base game is a quick, competitive Tournament through a randomly selected Dungeon. The first Adventurer, or Adventurers, to reach and defeat the Dungeon Guardian will be victorious. You may choose to cooperate at strategic points in the game, especially at the final Encounter where you may have to choose between winning with a friend or losing to your opponents. To add variety, Adventure IN also includes a fully cooperative Campaign. In the Campaign, you and the other players work together to try and beat a series of Dungeons. Each Dungeon has a unique layout, usually requiring that you defeat several Encounters before facing the Dungeon Guardian. This mode offers more strategy and depth, but also takes longer to play.

The Game features multiple Dungeons, various character combinations and a large variety of Treasures and other rewards that augment character abilities. All of this giving the game excellent replay ability!

Are you ready to Adventure IN?
154253.name: Adventure IN!

154254.name: A Call to Arms: Rules Supplement 2
154254.description:
The A Call to Arms Rules Supplement series brings you an array of new rules, information, articles and ships. It is an invaluable resource for any A Call to Arms player and will change the way you play your games!

Within Supplement 2 you will find wide variety of new articles designed to expand and develop the way you play A Call to Arms. Whether it is new rules for incorporating fleet carriers and beacon locks, stats for the Narn Gorith fighter, rules for using Captain John Sheridan in your games, or an in-depth study of the Earth Alliance Nova dreadnought, you will find something to get your teeth into. With a special scenario depicting Babylon 5 seceding from Earth, Supplement 2 is packed with great additions for A Call to Arms!

154255.description:
The Rav Laerst was a Breen battle cruiser in service in the 24th century. The Rav Laerst was commanded by Thot Uhlak.

In 2375, the Rav Laerst led a Breen fleet to Earth, where Starfleet Headquarters and San Francisco were attacked.

This ship is the competitive prize for Month 5 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Dominion War.
154255.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Rav Laerst Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

154256.description:
The Bajoran starship was a type of warp-capable starship utilized by the Bajoran Militia as an assault vessel, scout ship, and transport ship in the late-24th century. The Cardassian Union also used this type of vessel as an freighter during the war with the Klingons in 2372-73.

Utilized by the Bajorans following the Occupation of Bajor for a variety of uses, specifically as a one man scout and for transporting their soldiers in numbers as a transport vessel. Like Antares-class carriers, these vessels frequently made routine stops at Deep Space 9 during the 2370s.

This ship is the competitive prize for Month 6 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Dominion War.
154256.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Akorem Expansion Pack
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

154257.description:
The Hideki-class was a warp-capable multipurpose auxiliary craft used by the Cardassian Union's military during the late 24th century.

The class was used as an attack ship, a patrol ship, and a shuttlecraft. Smaller than Cardassian patrol cruisers, these ships could typically carry three to five occupants.

The ship was considered approximately equivalent to the Starfleet Danube-class runabout, but equipped with heavier armament giving it sufficient striking power to operate in fleet actions.

This ship is the participation prize for Month 5 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Dominion War.
154257.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Hideki Class Attack Fighters Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

154258.description:
The Federation attack fighter was a type of starship, employed by Starfleet as an attack fighter during the Dominion War.

During Operation Return, eight successive waves of fighters were sent to attack the Cardassian ships of a Dominion fleet, hoping to provoke them into breaking formation and creating an opening for the Federation fleet.

This ship type was also used as an Academy flight trainer by Starfleet Academy.

This ship is the participation prize for Month 6 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Dominion War.
154258.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Federation Attack Fighters Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
154259.description:
Two families vie for power as you settle a new provincial town. Build camps and banks, smithies and harbors and control growth as your town develops!

Province is a two-player game in which you must strategically manage your resources and workers to build, complete goals, and score the most victory points to win! The game features a communal worker pool representing the available workers in your town. Players move their workers to generate resources (Labor and Coin) that are used to build the various Structures, which in turn affect resource generation — but your opponent can also move the workers, leaving you without the resources you need!
154259.name: Province
boardgamepodcastepisode: CnC Plays EP 15 - Province
Dice Tower News 222 - February 21, 2014
Episode 15 - Province
New Games A Plenty

154260.name: Pier Solar and the Great Architects
154260.description:
Pier Solar and the Great Architects is a homebrew role-playing game for the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis, released in December 2010 by WaterMelon Co. The game optionally utilizes the Mega-CD expansion device to enhance its audio capabilities.

Pier Solar HD

On November 5, 2012, the game's developer WaterMelon announced on its Kickstarter page that it was developing the game for Xbox 360, PC, Mac, Linux and Sega Dreamcast. Later in the same month, WaterMelon elaborated their project further, additionally opening an opportunity to make the game available in Japanese, and to release the game on Android platforms, Ouya and Wii U. Early in the following December, the Kickstarter page successfully surpassed the project's minimum donation goal, and assured game's release on Wii U, which had the highest required stretch. On November 15, 2013, it was announced that the Xbox 360 version was currently delayed, and the game will come to both PlayStation 3 & PlayStation 4 in March 2014. WaterMelon announced their studio's acceptance into Microsoft's Xbox One developer program on December 4, 2013, as well as their intention to publish Pier Solar HD on the console.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pier solar", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

154261.name: Ein Rheinreisespiel
154261.description:
This is a beautiful early 20th Century game. The 60-space track takes the player along the Rhine River from Mainz to Cologne (Koln). The track includes illustrations of the many picturesque towns and sights along the way, with art by Emil Ernst Heinsdorff. The game comes with six very cute painted metal player tokens.

The game is simple: players roll a die and follow any instructions for the space on which they land, which are printed on the inside of the box. While the game is obviously suitable for children, some of the instructions to be followed seem equally suited to an adult drinking party. Landing on the famous statue of Lorelei, the player must sing a verse of "Ich Weiss nicht, was joll es bedeuten", and if any player lands on the town of Oberwesel, everyone must immediately rise and belt out a verse from a Rhein song of their choice!

The First Edition is usually dated to c. 1910, while the Second Edition (with a painting of the town of Bacharach on the box cover) dates to c. 1924.

154262.description:
6 Scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader depicting the Soviet's drive for Minsk during Operation Bagration, the last week of June 1944.

The Germans have deployed the 5th Panzer Division to Minsk, hoping to keep the escape routes open in the face of the onslaught of Red Army juggernaut. The Soviet armoured forces have burst through the German Army Group Centre's defensive front and are streaming westwards. The 5th Panzer Division, a formidable unit with near 300 tanks, and reinforced with Tiger Is of Schewere Panzer Abteilung 505, must fight to keep the roads and rail lines open, allowing for the remnants of the German 4th Army to escape.

Scenario Information:

Krupki Station, Russia, 28 June 1944: On 22 June, three years after the German invasion of the Soviet Union, codenamed: BARBAROSSA, the Red Army launched its own offensive, Operation BAGRATION in Byelorussia. By 28 June, the Red Army steamroller smashed through the German defences of Army Group Centre and were closing in on the city of Minsk. Hastily the Tigers of Schwere Panzer Abteilung 505 was rushed forward to a railway station outside the village of Krupki to block the Russians and keep the highway open...
GERMAN FORCES: 3x AFV
RUSSIAN FORCES: 10x AFV
BOARDS: 4, 5, q, x
GAME LENGTH: 4.5


Kostritsa, Russia, 29 June 1944: The Russian armoured forces fought a sharp engagement through the night, but finally managed to captured Krupki Station. As day broke, following up mechanized forces continued their westward advance, overtaking German stragglers as they went. The German 14th Infantry Division left its 11th Regiment as a rearguard on the approaches to Borisov, hoping to gain some time to allow the stragglers to get across the Berezina River...
GERMAN FORCES: 6x Squads, 2x Leaders, 1x Gun, Fortifications
RUSSIAN FORCES: 13x Squads, 3x Leaders, 2x AFV
BOARDS: q
GAME LENGTH: 6


Studenka, Russia, 29 June 1944: The Soviet juggernaut surged forward, overrunning German defences as it went. The 3rd Byelorussian Front closed on the city Minsk, but was struggling with German's 5th Panzer Division, to find a crossing of the Berezina River. As the Soviet armoured forces probed north of Borisov, they were being rebuffed by German Panzer-Abteilung Aufklarung 5 time after time...
GERMAN FORCES: 6.5 x Squads, 3x Leaders, 1x Gun, 4x AFV
RUSSIAN FORCES: 10x Squads, 2x Leaders, 10x AFV
BOARDS: 40, 57
GAME LENGTH: 6


Borisov, Russia, 30 June 1944: The Soviet armoured spearheads were unstoppable - the Germans could only hope to buy time for the evacuation of Minsk. As five rifle divisions of the Soviet 11th Guards Army closed with Berezina River, the lead armoured foreces of the 3rd Guards Tank Corps smashed its way into Borisov, attempting to capture the bridges over the Berezina from the Germans who were trying to hold them open as long as possible to allow forces to evacuate across them...
GERMAN FORCES: 8x Squads, 3x Leaders, Fortifications
RUSSIAN FORCES: 15x Squads, 3x Leaders, 10x AFV
BOARDS: 8, 51
GAME LENGTH: 8


Pleschenitsy, Russia, 1 July 1944: The Soviet spearheads were converging on Minsk from three directions (North, East, and South). The German's 5th Panzer Division with support of the Tigers of Schwere Panzer Abteilung 505 had mounted an effective defence east of Minsk, centred along the Moscow-Minsk Highway, intended to keep the railway lines open to allow evacuation of the city. The Soviets pushed the 5th Guards Tank Army north attempting to flank the strong German defences...
GERMAN FORCES: 8x Squads, 3x Leaders, 2x Gun, 7x AFV
RUSSIAN FORCES: 13x Squads, 3x Leaders, 18x AFV
BOARDS: 4, 44, 57
GAME LENGTH: 8.5


Minsk, Russia, 3 July 1944: The Soviet Armoured spearheads closed in on the city from the North, East, and South; standing in their way was 1,800 poorly organized troops who were tasked to keep at bay, while the 35,000 unarmed stragglers, wounded, and rear echelon staff from Army Group Centre Headquarters could flee the city by train. In the early morning hours, the Soviets load up as many infantry as possible on to its tanks raced forward...
GERMAN FORCES: 7x Squads, 2x Leaders, 1x Gun, Fortifications
RUSSIAN FORCES: 7x Squads, 2x Leaders, 7x AFV
BOARDS: 1, 49
GAME LENGTH: 5.5
154262.name: Ost Front 2

154263.name: On Guard
154263.description:
On Guard is played on a 7x7 square grid of raised circles on which the circular, stackable playing pieces rest. Two players each of have 24 pieces of either yellow or orange, and begin the game by taking turns placing their single pieces (Guards) anywhere on the board but for the center circle. Each player on his first turn must create an Officer by moving one of his Guards onto another.

Guards may move horizontally or vertically to the next adjacent vacant space, and may not jump or capture. Officers may move any number of (unobstructed) spaces horizontally or vertically, even making 90 degree turns, and may jump and eliminate other Officers, but not Guards. Only one Office can be made per turn.

To win the game, capture all the opponent's Officers, or block him from moving any remaining pieces.

154264.name: Yoo-Doo
154264.description: Yoo-Doo consists of three six-sided dice, one with letters, one with numbers, and one with colors, 200 orange chips, and a rectangular board divided into a 12x18 grid of squares, each indexed by a letter, a number, and a color. Players take turns rolling all three dice and placing chips on the corresponding squares on the board. First player to place a chip on an existing chip then collects all the chips from the board and tallies his score for that round. The player with the highest score after five rounds wins the game.

154265.name: Chee Chow: The Mystic Seven
154265.description: Chee Chow is a competitive game of Tangrams for up to four players. Included are traditional tangram sets of seven pieces each (2 large right triangles, 1 medium right triangle, 2 small right triangles, 1 square, and 1 parallelogram) in four colors, and a number of cards with silhouetted shapes the players must try to form with their own pieces. First player to complete their puzzle wins. A book with solutions and an entertaining bogus background story are included.

154266.name: Golden Age Supers #1
154266.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the heroes and villains of yore into your Icons games! Fully compatible with Icons Role Playing game of superheroics!

In this issue you get:

Amazing Man
Amazona
Alias the Dragon
Queen Alice
Ace the Amazing Boy

154267.name: Golden Age Supers #2
154267.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the heroes and villains of yore into your Icons games! Fully compatible with Icons Role Playing game of superheroics!

In this issue you get:

Atlas the Mighty
Ant Queen
American Eagle
Apollo
Ardora

154268.name: Golden Age Supers #3
154268.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the heroes and villains of yore into your Icons games! Fully compatible with Icons Role Playing game of superheroics!

In this issue you get:

Atoma
Airman
Akina
Arrow
American Crusader

154269.name: Golden Age Supers #4
154269.description:
From publisher blurb:

Now you can bring the heroes and villains of yore into your Icons games! Fully compatible with Icons Role Playing game of superheroics!

In this issue you get:

Archer
Avenger
Ambrose Bell
Argo
Airmale

154270.name: River Core Set
154270.description:
From publisher blurb:

The River Core Set is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

The River Core Set is a geomorphic set, comprising 6 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each component features a river surrounded by countryside/wilderness.

Straight
Fork
Bend
Meander
Cliff
Rapids




Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

154271.name: Reflex Arcade Stick with Dual Force
videogamehwversion: Reflex Arcade Stick with Dual Force for XBox
154271.description:
From the back of the box:
If you are playing fighting games on your XBox with a standard pad, you need to get on the stick. The Radica Gamester RC71103 Reflex arcade stick, that is. The first arcade stick with Dual Force Vibration. The Reflex RC71103 combines high-quality buttons and two sturdy, interchangeable sticks with the sleekest design on the planet.

So whether you're playing Dead or Alive 3 or any other fighting game, you'll have a distinct advantage...The Unfair Advantage!

154272.name: Hold the Chain
154272.description:
Fourth Series Pitch of the Month (February 2014)

Publisher Blurb: You are the entertainment in the gladiatorial arena of a steam-powered flying city on the brink of revolution.

User Summary:
The setting of Hold the Chain is in flying steampunk city that has become a dystopia. While the majority of play will probably take place within the confines of the galadiatorial arena, players can eventually find their way out into the wider city.

Player roles can include:
•Up and coming fighter
•The innocent man sentenced to combat
•The grizzled trainer
•The revolutionary legend hiding among the fighters
•and many others

154273.name: The Room Two
videogamehonor: 2014 British Academy Game Awards Best British Game of the Year Nominee
2014 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
154273.description:
Welcome to The Room Two, a physical puzzler, wrapped in a mystery game, inside a beautifully tactile 3D world.
The much anticipated sequel to ‘The Room’, Apple’s Game of the Year 2012 and recipient of a BAFTA award, is here at last.

Follow a trail of cryptic letters from an enigmatic scientist known only as "AS" into a compelling world of mystery and exploration.

Source: The Developer Website.

154274.description:
From the Game Instructions:

Change tracks tactically and cleverly to get to the target space!

In Indian Sanskrit, Samsara means "constant wandering" and stands for the eternal cycle, the wheel of life.

All playing pieces move continually in a loop. Who will realize his own possibilities and take the path to his own target space by tactically and cleverly changing tracks?

Game Equipment:

18 x 39 x 2 cm gameboard made of solid beechwood, treated with protective oils
12 playing pieces and 2 scoring pieces (12 red and 2 white marbles)
wooden 2 dice




Aus der Spielanleitung:

Mit taktisch klugen Spurwechseln den Weg zum Zielfeld einschlagen!

Im indischen Sanskrit bedeutet Samsara „Beständiges Wandern“ und steht für den ewigen Kreislauf, das Rad des Lebens.

Alle Spielsteine bewegen sich fortwährend „im Kreis”. Wer erkennt die eigenen Möglichkeiten und schlägt mit taktisch geschicktem Spurwechsel den Weg zum eigenen Zielfeld ein?

Spielausstattung:

Spielbrett aus massiver geölter Buche 18 x 39 x 2 cm
12 Spielsteine, 2 Wertungssteine (12 rote und 2 weiße Murmeln)
2 Holzwürfel
154274.name: Samsara
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2014 - Samsara
The Spiel #202 - Suitcase Six-Pack

154275.name: Qwirkle
154275.description:
User Summary

This is the 2013 iOS version of the Qwirkle boardgame.

The game features 108 blocks with six different shapes in six different colors. Players begin the game with 6 blocks. The start player plays blocks of a single matching attribute (color or shape but not both). Thereafter, a player adds blocks adjacent to at least one previously played block. The blocks must all be played in a line and match, without duplicates, either the color or shape of the previous block.

Players score one point for each block played plus all blocks adjacent. It is possible for a block to score in more than one direction. If a player completes a line containing all 6 shapes or colors, an additional 6 points are scored. The player then refills his hand to 6 blocks.

The game ends when all tiles have been distributed, and one player plays all of his remaining blocks, earning a 6 point bonus. The player with the high score wins.

This implementation features 4 levels of AI opponents, and the ability to customize the colors of the blocks.

154276.name: Vulgruph's Hollow
154276.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The once prosperous village of Vulgruph’s Hollow has become a den of murder and mistrust as what started as a series of odd animal mutilations has escalated into disappearances among the populace. Built on and across the mouth of a creek, even the stone walls and stoic guards of this dwarven village have done little to bring peace and security to its residents.

Village Backdrops are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single village ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure, as an adventure site themselves or as a PC’s home, Village Backdrop present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

154277.name: El Generale
154277.description:
El Generale is a light wargame. Players are leaders of small countries, that want to reach a certain position on the international scene.

The main goal is to accumulate the most money at the end of the sixth turn of the game.

Every player starts with his own country, the same amount of money, people and the same infrastructure. And of course a handful of Generals for their army. During the game each player has to invest in the military strength (defense and offense), transportation and hospitals to see his country grow.

Attacking other players weakens their ability to generate money. But no one should forget about defense.

154278.name: Legacy of the Slayer
154278.description:
From the designer:

The ghost stories you've heard are true. There are things that go bump in the night and they really do want to hurt you. But you've chosen to stand up and fight back. It won't be easy, but your friends and your town need you. The world needs you. Look out, Evil: the hunter has become the hunted.

Create your own world based off of popular series where (relatively) normal people fight off supernatural threats in a modern setting, usually in secret. Draft characters with cards that define their talents, flaws, relationships and liabilities. Modify the cards as your characters grow and change organically.

Begin playing immediately with no preparation required. There are no dice; Just tell the story you want to tell, featuring the quirks that bring your characters to life and the twists that make the genre great. All you need is a pen/marker of a different color for each player to mark the cards (there are enough for three extended campaigns).

what is in the box

This boxed set comes with 108 cards and a 20-page rulebook in an easy to carry deck box.

154279.name: GM's Miscellany: Village Backdrops
154279.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Village Backdrops are short, richly detailed supplements that each present a single village ready to insert into almost any home campaign. Perfect for use as a waystop on the road to adventure, as an adventure site themselves or as a PC’s home, Village Backdrop present the details so the busy GM can focus on crafting exciting, compelling adventures.

This GM’s Miscellany collects together the first twelve Village Backdrops, along with bonus, never seen before material, together in one place.

GM’s Miscellany: Village Backdrops is the work of many talented designers and features the following villages:


John Bennett: Bossin, Denton’s End, Hosford, Oakhurst
Creighton Broadhurst: Ashford, Longbridge, Thornhill
Eric Hindley: Golden Valley
Ben Kent: Apia, Roake
Greg Marks: Hard Bay
Marc Radle: White Moon Cove

154280.name: Mike the Knight Ritter-Wettlauf
154280.description: The players move through the kingdom of Glendragon to the castle, where Mike the Knight is waiting for them. Lucky rolls of the die and the help of the jolly dragons Funki and Löschi allow a quick advance, while the vikings try everything to hinder the progress of the players.

154281.description:
In Legends and Lies each player is a Cryptozoologist mounting expeditions in an attempt to prove the existence of certain unknown creatures such as Bigfoot, The Loch Ness Monster or Extraterrestrials. Each ultimately hopes to gain fame and fortune by being credited with the actual discovery of a new species. While searching the globe for solid proof of these creatures existence each Cryptozoologist can attempt to discredit their competitor’s discoveries by leaking wild stories to the tabloid press. Turnabout is, of course, fair play….

Basic Game Play Overview:
During each turn players draw from either the Unknown (draw pile) or from the top of Tabloids (discard pile). Each player creates or adds to melds using Expedition cards in order to reach ten or more points. If ten or greater points is achieved that expedition would be considered to have found enough proof for science to take notice, thereby doubling that set's score. Also during each turn a single Anomaly card (action card) may be played which can do things like strengthen the value of an expedition in play, retrieve cards from the Tabloids, discredit other players expeditions or manipulate other facets of the game. At the end of a round, cards in the Tabloids that match expeditions in play discredit that expedition. The game also has a shut-out rule involving Extraterrestrials that, if achieved, prevents all other players from scoring that round.
154281.name: Legends and Lies

154282.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 205 - 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room At The Games Pit
Meet the Cast of the KODT Live Action Series
The Games Pit A Critical Look
154282.description:
"The Untouchable Fab Four"

Cover by George Vrbanic

154283.name: No Room at the Zoo
154283.description:
It's not easy trying to get all your animals into the zoo because there just isn't enough room for all of them. You may even end up with more animals than you started with.

The zoo is divided into four coloured zones. In each zone there are coloured rings for individual animals. Game play chooses the coloured zone each player must place an animal in and as an animal cannot be placed on a ring which is overlapped by a ring already containing an animal things can get a little squashed. Any player that cannot place an animal in the required zone must pick up all the animals in that zone. The winner is the first to get rid of all his animals.

154284.name: Path of Bones
154284.description:
From the publisher:

Path of Bones is a fast paced cinematic martial arts combat game. Hordes of troops. Powerful heroes. Exotic locales. Unparalleled action And no dice.

Path of Bones uses dominoes - "bones" - instead of dice to run its combat system. Engagements run on a two-tiered system: troops mass and press their advantage together; heroes combine their marital arts styles into devastating attacks.

The rules provide an intriguing system of simultaneous attack and defense based on the two sides of the dominoes drawn by you and your opponent. Equipment and character types provide options for over forty different types of common troops. There are thousands and thousands of ways to combine the martial arts styles from the rules to make heroes ... and a guide to customizing the system to your own tastes.

With the base rules you get nine combat scenarios:

One set allows a band of heroes to progress through a traditional Chinese story
Another sets the stage for fighting the Mongol Invasion of Japan
A set up for the epic climactic battle of the Forty Seven Ronin
Each combat scenario is playable as a stand-alone game, with options for replay value
Twenty-five pages of print-and-play terrain to support the scenarios right away




The game plays well from as few as forty to fifty figures total (both sides) up to about five hundred. It was playtested with 25-28mm figures using standard size dominoes and 15-28mm figures using mini dominoes. Bones are used to measure movement as well as resolve combat.

154287.name: Lego FU: Heroic Adventures in the Lego Universe
154287.description:
from the introduction:

This FU expansion will guide you in playing stories set in the Lego universe. It contains information about the setting and customisations of the rules to give your play a Lego ‘feel’, as well as tips to convert just about any other roleplaying game into a Lego game. The ideas in this expansion are based on the many Lego short movies available online, Lego video games, and the feature length film "The Adventures of Clutch Powers".

In Lego FU, you play adventurer minifigs (the small, plastic articulated minifigurines in the Lego universe) exploring the Lego world, helping others along the way. Your stories will take you across the many Lego worlds playing a variety of characters from pirates on the high seas to space police protecting colonists on far-flung planets. While you venture forth, your minifig will build the world around you, creating solutions out of Lego technology to make the world a better place.

154288.name: Was das Kind träumt
154288.description:
Goal: Be the first to reaching position '40' (parents celebrating x-mas)

Game Play:
Typical 'roll & move' game - Roll the die by turns and step forward - ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid. Each player has to buy play money first; ending on a red space - get one coin/ white one - pay one coin; winner gets 2/3rd, second 1/3 of the remaining cash.

Notes:
should had been published ~1905-1910 (Zeppelin drawing)

154289.description:
You are the leader of a survivor camp on the edge of a city named Pazic. Each round you must decide whether each of your survivors will go after objectives to collect resources, enhance your camp, recruit other survivors, or attack the other camps.

Every survivor card in the deck is two-sided, and when a survivor is wounded, infected, or killed, the card can be turned over to become a zombie card, with the world slowly but surely having fewer and fewer survivors and increasingly more zombies.

The winner of PAZIC (Post-Apocalyptic Zombie Infested City) is the last camp leader to have any survivors left in his camp, whether by eliminating the other camps or creating a camp so powerful that it can continue to survive the onslaught longer than the other camps as resources and survivors become harder to find.
154289.name: PAZIC (Post-Apocalyptic Zombie Infested City)

154290.name: The Stellar Clarion (Issue 1 - Jun 2006)
154290.description:
The Stellar Clarion

Death in Baliwood

Raid on McNair!

154296.name: Gentlemen...Ricochet!
154296.description:
“Gentlemen...Ricochet!” is a puzzle-action game in which you shoot a token through devious puzzles to get to the end goal. It is played like a tabletop game remiscient of real-life games like bumper pool and pinnochi. You can shoot multiple times, but your token must be stopped in specific zones to do so. Each level has three stars to catch and a specific par to follow.

FEATURES

Varied levels and gameplay mechanics: Including destructible walls, canons, punching gloves and a gravity bending button. 72 levels in all.
Interactive menus: Smallbridge, the game's village, is used as a hub that evolves as you play.
Great cast of funny characters: Meet Gent, Raptor, Steve, Sir Gilberton’s maid and Margaret.
Collect them all: Complete levels in the least shots possible and by getting all three stars to get trophies. You then unlock playable "tokens" through the game's own achievement system
Absolutely free of in game purchases and Universal App.

Source: The Game Website.

154297.name: Combat Mission: Red Thunder
154297.description:
Combat Mission: Red Thunder focuses on the hard fought battles from the swamps of Belarus to the gates of Warsaw during the summer of 1944. Experience the most balanced period of tactical warfare on the Eastern Front, even as the Axis' strategic ability to wage war began to collapse. Play out historical battles and campaigns or create your own customized Quick Battles. All new units, new terrain, and new features make this a must have for all Combat Mission fans.

Source: The Publisher Website.

154298.description:
Alchemy! is a card game that turns 2-5 players into competing apprentice alchemists trying to impress their master by being the first to complete a set of potions in a laboratory space they all share. Every turn, players can rush to finish their work or sabotage those who are pursuing the same potions they are, and once you've completed a potion, you can keep it for victory points or drink it to try to get even further ahead.

Every turn, players draw cards and 'transmute' a component from a pool they share with all of the other players at the table in order to produce 'elements' (earth, air, fire, water) that can then be combined to try to match the formulas at the bottom of the potion cards that act as victory points.

Potions are randomized each game, so each match has its own feel - some are very directly competitive, producing potions that allow players to directly attack one another, and others require more indirection and planning. Analyzing the available potions and trying to predict the interplay between them and the value of victory points vs. the effects of the potions is a key element of play.
154298.name: Alchemy!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dice Tower News 222 - February 21, 2014

154299.description: Two Hundred is a point-based trick-taking game in which players try to win tricks containing aces, tens and fives. The standard form of Two Hundred is for four players in partnerships using 36 cards and playing to a target score of 200 (after which the game is named), although many variations exist.

154300.name: Dungeon Keeper (Mobile)
154300.description:
User Summary

Dungeon Keeper (mobile) is a strategy video game released for IOS and Android in which, in a similar to its PC version, the player attempts to build and manage a dungeon or lair while protecting it from AI characters that intent on stealing the user's accumulated treasures and killing various monsters.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
2014 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
154301.description:
FOR OFFICIAL ERRATA AND FAQ, LOOK IN THE FILES SECTION

The Battle at Kemble's Cascade is a board game adaptation of a classic shoot 'em up video game. In the game, which is played out on a scrolling space backdrop, the players take on the roles of brave space pilots sweeping around in nimble yet powerful fighters, searching the asteroid clusters for universal glory and ancient technology. Players compete to obtain the most glory, with glory resulting from carrying out missions, finding lost treasure in asteroid clusters, and destroying alien entities, not to mention other players.

In the game, players fly through an ever-scrolling space setting, which is represented by rows of cards. Each turn, the bottom row is removed and a new row is added to the top. Players move their spaceships and resolve effects continuously, performing actions such as collecting power-ups and money, fighting alien cruisers and titans, blocking and shooting other players, and dodging asteroids and black holes. The players need to balance the use of their ships' energy as it's used for both absorbing enemy fire and boosting their movement speed and fire rate.

The game includes missions and achievements as well as a mechanism called "threat level" to keep everyone in suspense throughout the whole game. Threat allows players to enjoy the satisfaction of both shooting wildly at each other and dodging the hundreds of bullets raining down from enemy fighters and other players.

All player ships are fully upgradeable with four different weapon classes, engines, shields and more. Each player must buy the upgrades and navigate the path that best fits his chosen strategy in order to successfully complete his missions and attain the most glory.
154301.name: The Battle at Kemble's Cascade
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dukes of Dice Podcast - Ep. 11 - Extra Life 2014
Episode 27: Splendor, Blueprints, Gen Con Preview and Travel Gaming
Episode 35: The Battle at Kemble’s Cascade and Gaming with Kids
Episode 5: Kemble’s Cascade, But Wait, There’s More! and Chalk Digital
Episode 82-- LIVE from Gen Con 2014 Part 1
Strange Assembly 146 - GenCon 2014 in Review, Part 2
Strange Assembly 157 - Your Name Here
Strange Assembly 159 - Double Back
Summoning 19: Tyrland Brothers
The Seventh Peg Ep. 11- Olle and Anders Tylrand

154303.name: Tropico 4: Apocalypse
154303.description:
The Cold War has turned hot and nuclear conflict is inevitable. Prepare the island nation of Tropico for the coming apocalypse and carefully choose which resources and factions to save from certain eradication. The new Nuclear Shelter provides and converts faction bonuses depending on its work mode. Don the new Hazmat suit and choose the Survivalist trait to become a true doomsday prepper.

Key Features:
- New building: Nuclear Shelter (provides bonuses depending on work mode)
- New trait: Survivalist (Tropicans need less food)
- New outfit: Hazmat suit
- New mission: How I learned to love the bomb - Survive a doomsday scenario

Source: The Publisher Website.

154304.name: Tropico 4: The Academy
154304.description:
Due to a budget SNAFU (for which Penultimo is not responsible), the remote island of Isla Guerra is revolting against El Presidente's regime. Tropico needs to recruit skilled cadets via the new East Point Academy and prepare for a large scale assault by an invading enemy army. The East Point Graduate trait enables El Presidente to prevail against enemies in combat and the Cadet's uniform completes this military-centric package.

Key Features:
- New building: East Point Academy (provides college and military education, cadets are skilled soldiers and generals)
- New trait: East Point Graduate (enemies are always killed and not wounded by El Presidente in combat)
- New outfit: East Point Cadet (female avatar)
- New mission: Peace, Love and Understanding – Repel a large scale foreign invasion

Source: The Publisher Website.

154305.name: Tropico 4: Propaganda
154305.description:
Tropico is invited to participate in the International Communist Propaganda competition! Turn the most absurd propaganda slogans into reality using the new Propaganda Tower building which suppresses protesters and converts citizens to loyalists, use the PR Specialist trait to brainwash your people and finally compete with the likes of Stalin and Lenin with the Party Leader outfit.

Key Features:
- New building: Propaganda Tower (suppresses protests and converts citizens)
- New trait: PR Specialist (journalists brainwash citizens to vote for El Presidente)
- New outfit: Party Leader
- New mission: The Communist Propaganda Competition

Source: The Publisher Website.

154306.name: Tropico 4: Voodoo
154306.description:
Poor healthcare is responsible for the death of the last remaining voodoo priest on Tropico. A new threat rises when the evil sorceress Vanya arrives from Soviet Russia to curse El Presidente and his regime. Study the mystical ways of voodoo and use them to your benefit with the new Voodoo Manor tourist attraction, impress your people by wearing a fancy Witch Doctor costume combined with a new voodoo trait enabling your people to survive even with the poorest of healthcare.

Key Features:
- New building: Voodoo Manor (a luxury tourist attraction)
- New trait: Witch Doctor (Tropicans need less healthcare)
- New outfit: Witch Doctor
- New mission: The Big Voodoo Shuffle – Create an El Presidente voodoo doll to contain the curse!

Source: The Publisher Website.

154307.name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team
154307.description:
Provided by Publisher:

Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team puts you in charge of a motley band of warriors, whose skill, determination and courage will be put to the test as they undertake dangerous do-or-die missions deep behind enemy lines. As each of your models acts independently from the rest of his squad, their individual actions – even a single kill – can mean the difference between victory and defeat.

Whether you choose an elite team of stalwart heroes or a small horde of expendable conscripts to form your Kill Team, they must all fight with one purpose if they are to achieve their mission objectives.

You will need a copy of the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook and relevant codexes in order to use the contents of this book.

154308.name: Cling Thing
154308.description:
No one knows where exactly these colorful, squidgy, grinning orbs came from. All we know is this: they’re very clingy! Tap to stretch their gooey tendrils to nearby walls and objects and use multi-touch to navigate them through all manner of sticky situations.

Get stuck in
Use your Cling Thing’s grip ability to swing around all 96 perplexing contraptions. Reach for the stars scattered around each level to race against the clock for medals.

Stretched in all Directions
Use your sticky abilities to solve puzzles and experiment with physics to reach the escape pipe. Stuck? Try using multi-touch to latch on to multiple surfaces at once.

Pipe Dream
From soothing piano tunes to acoustic guitar melodies, Cling Thing’s calming soundtrack is the perfect antidote to its fiendishly tricky puzzles.

Game Features:
• Tap to make your Cling Thing stick to its surroundings
• Over 96 levels of viscous fun with 360 stars to find
• Play with physics to solve these sticky puzzles
• Colorful visuals and a relaxing piano-driven soundtrack
• UNIVERSAL: Clings well on iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad

Source: The Publisher Website.

154309.name: Shadowrun Digital Tools Box
154309.description:
From the publishers web-site:
The Shadowrun Digital Tools Box is 2 box sets in 1! Whether you’re just getting into Shadowrun or you’re a runner that’s been hitting the streets since the 2050s, you’ll find useful material here for running any type of game. Here’s what you get!

Shadowrun Beginner Box Set
The Shadowrun Beginner Box is the easiest way to dive into the intrigue, grit and action of one of the most enduring role-playing settings of all time! Tailor-designed for an easy-on-the-credstick entry, the Beginner Box includes the following:

•The Edge of Now gives the flavor and background of the Sixth World
•Quick-Start Rules: Fast rules and a quick adventure to whet your appetite for more.
•A pre-generated character booklet: Allows for a gamemaster and one person to run a solo adventure.
•5 pre-generated character sheets: Details that’ll allow up to five players to play with the help of a gamemaster.
Whether you’re new to Shadowrun or new to roleplaying, this package will get you into the fun of hacking, shooting, and spellslinging your way to the top!

Runner's Toolkit: Alphaware
Scan This, Chummers:

•Do you play Shadowrun now and are looking for a set of tools to allow you to more easily run your existing group, or that’ll allow you to introduce new gamers to your favorite RPG at your local game store or hangout?
•Are you a gamemaster ready to give Shadowrun a shot, and you want a few extra tools at your disposal from the first toss of your dice?
•Have you tackled the Beginner Box and are ready to move up in the Sixth World?
Say yes to any of those? Then the Runner’s Toolkit: Alphaware is the box set for you.

Designed to provide adventures, maps, and tools to use in conjunction with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition, or to be the perfect stepping-stone between the Shadowrun Beginner Box and the core rulebook, this box can fill a number of roles. Whether you’re looking for more tools to help your existing gaming group, or adventures and options to move beyond the Beginner Box, laying the groundwork for your gaming group to move fully onto Shadowrun, Fifth Edition, you’ll find this kit invaluable.

This box has all you need to play a game of Shadowrun, including:

•Rules of the Street: An 88-page rulebook designed to be accessible and simple to use.
•Plots and Paydata: 80 pages of adventures and tips for any Shadowrun gamemaster.
•Eight double-sided maps to help players and GMs track the action.
•110 spell, weapon, and gear cards for quick reference.
•5 pre-generated characters players can use right away.

Fire & Frost Novel Excerpt
An exclusive, first access to a 48-page excerpt from the forthcoming Shadowrun novel, Fire & Frost, the first all-new original Sixth World novel in years!

Print Pre-Order Codes
